Reviews.Title: “Perfect Stay in Perfect Location on Key West”
Reviews.Author: jbulth39
Reviews.Content: My wife and I chose the Pier House after reading a lot of positive reviews on Trip Advisor recommending it. We stayed for 5 nights. It was an all around great experience. The staff was all very friendly, the accomodations we excellent and the location can't be beat. With the hotel right on the North end of Duval Street where it meets the ocean almost anything in to see/do in Key west is a 10 minute walk away. The harbor is just to the east, Mallory Square to the west and most of Duval street is right there for you. My wife was 5 months pregnant so the short walks were VERY appreciated. They do offer free parking if you need to get anywhere far and have a car you neet to store while you are in town. We took everyone's advice and got a room facing the Gulf. Some of the rooms do border close to Duval/Front street which gets loud especially close to bar closing time so something facing the garden/pool in the center of the hotel or facing the harbor will be MUCH quieter. If you are someone who might still be in the bar at closing time it won't matter. We were there over college spring break time and some people on our floor started to get a little rowdy before heading out one night but hotel security shut that down around 11:00 and made sure they knew to take the party someplace else after getting back for the evening. I've been to some hotels where the staff is reluctant to get anyone upset so the quick action was appreciated. Other plusses: - Both my wife and I felt the breakfast at the cafe each morning was excellent. There was no need to go elsewhere unless you wanted something quick before heading to an activity for the day. - Housekeeping leaves a door hanger where you can mark when you will be out of the room so they know when to come in and clean up while you are gone. - The wine bar has live entertainment each evening which we found to be very good and wrapped up at the right time. Good for sitting out and relaxing at the end of the day. - The beach attendants to a nice job cleaning up the beach throughout the day so that it's always very orderly on their beach. No seaweed or empty glasses moving around. - Free towels and water at the beach and pool. Nice. Our only complaints: - While the breakfast was very delicious they need more waitstaff in the morning. Two waiters for around 20 tables in the morning just doesn't cut it. - The chairs for the beach and the pool are older and kind of uncomfortable. They could use an upgrade. Just a really nice well done experience from a hotel in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “A Sanctuary in the Heart of Key West”
Reviews.Author: DKLAG
Reviews.Content: My wife and I, along with another couple just returned from Key West. We had never been there and booked the Pier House after the many recommendations I saw on this site. We couldn't have been more pleased! It is in a perfect location (right at the end of Duval), the staff was great, the rooms were wonderful (great view from water front suite), it has it's own beach/heated pool and the food/drink was awesome. It really is a sanctuary from the action on Duval. In fact, you would have never known that you were so close to action because of the peace and quiet. I would certainly recommend the Pier House to anyone heading down.

Reviews.Title: “Best Views in Key West- plus free parking/WiFi!”
Reviews.Author: SunPrincess9000
Reviews.Content: My husband and I returned to Key West and we stayed in the corner Dockside suite for 3 nights. Having stayed at Ocean Key across the street before, we knew we liked the location at the end of Duvel Street, and thought we would try Pier House. We splurged on the dockside suite(room 807- first floor), as we really like just chilling on the deck, and watching the sunsets. The view was epic, you can see all the party boats cruise by at sunset, and watch all the action along the pier from your deck chair.The deck wrapped around 2 sides, with 2 loungers and 2 chairs and small table. Like another reviewer said, there is a large public area under these rooms, and there was a small crowd there for sunset. I would recommend getting a room on the second floor of the dockside building (6 rooms, 3 per floor) as it would be more private. The room itself was clean, very bright, if small. It was laid out in a way that the living room (with pull out) was in the front, with the bathroom between the living room and rear bedroom, in a sort of ' Jack and Jill' design. This room would work for 2 couples, or a family of 4. The property itself is quite lager, but laid out well, so it feels casual. There several buildings, connected by pathways and filled in with lush gardens a water features. The pool is small, but open 24 hours, and there is a small private beach. The beach is groomed every morning (seaweed cleaned up), there is towel and lounge chair service, and a raft anchored in the swimming area. The beach is sheltered from the bay, so would be ok for smaller kids (but no life guard). There are two bars on site; one very small, and full of locals, and another right by the beach. There is also a restaurant on site, that we ate at twice. The food was ok, nothing special. We were pleasant surprised with the Free Parking ( no valet service) and free, fast, Wi-FI. Overall, this is a great resort in a perfect location. If you are going to come all this way to Key West I would splurge on a dockside suite and bask in the best sunsets you will ever see.

Reviews.Title: “The only place to stay in Key West”
Reviews.Author: Charles B
Reviews.Content: Just back from 7 nights in Key West our annual trip for the last 6 years,we have always stayed at the Pier House the last few years in a Harbor View room you get what you pay for. Everything was great from the front desk,beach,beach bar&grill,room,weather,what else could you want. I guess we will be back next Feb. Charles&Connie

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay. Friendly and helpful staff.”
Reviews.Author: keyscool
Reviews.Content: I live in the area but had family visiting who wanted to spend one night in Key West. We stayed on a Wednesday night. The property is absolutely beautiful with tropically landscaped pathways throughout the resort. The rooms were clean and very comfortable. The waterfall shower was incredible. The pool and beach are fantastic. The food was very good and reasonably priced. The staff were all very nice, especially Lee at the front desk. I look forward to staying here again and would highly recommend it for people traveling without children.

Reviews.Title: “Great place on its own beach with awesome location”
Reviews.Author: michygal05
Reviews.Content: We went here for a long wknd and loved this hotel. We stayed in the Caribbean Spa rooms which were a bit more expensive but worth it. They were away from the main hotel area near the spa so they were very quiet. The rooms were nice and large and had separate bathroom with small sitting area along with a TV. The location is amazing. You can just park your car in the parking lot ( free parking) and walk anywhere! The hotel has its own beach with a small bar/ restaurant which was wonderful and convenient. We didnt have a room with a balcony but the building our room was in had outdoor sitting areas and patios that were so quaint and comfortable. The front desk/ reception were very helpful and friendly. We loved this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “perfect”
Reviews.Author: mkaye03
Reviews.Content: I was surprised with a stay here, and I'm so glad. The room was beautiful, clean, comfortable beds, and in an ideal location. Our room had a great view and a quaint sitting balcony. You can walk down Duval Street or to Mallory Square with ease. The beach is exceptional, esspecially for the keys. I know this because I live in Key Largo. The service I saw, my boyfriend did all the planning, was outstanding. There was even an attendant that set up our beach chairs for us, and for the tanning ladies, asked which angle to face the chair to the sun. Theres a bar/restaurant near the water and they will come take your order from your beach chair. *they make a fantastic bloody mary* The pool was a great temp and not to much chlorine. My boyfriend said it'd had better be this perfect for what he paid for it, so I guess it may have been expensive, I dont know.. I do know that now it's the only place I want to stay in Key West!!

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful long weekend.”
Reviews.Author: Aim225
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went here for a long weekend in February for my birthday and it was wonderful. We stayed in a Harbour View room and it was perfect. We woke up looking at the ocean and a palm tree. The food at the beach bar and the cafe were delicious! Even though they are located right on Duval street you would never know it. You are in such a tropical setting and the only thing you hear are the waves from the Gulf of Mexico. The beach area may seem small but other hotels have no beach at all. We thought it was perfect,never too crowded. The only complaint we had was that we couldn't stay longer. Can't wait to go back!!

Reviews.Title: “DREADFUL!! DID NOT EVEN PROVIDE TOILET TISSUE, REFILL COFFEE OR SHOWER CAPS TILL WE'D PHONED TO COMPLAIN!!”
Reviews.Author: Lol H
Reviews.Content: We'd booked this hotel through a company we've used successfully many times before which was a big mistake in this case as we'd paid them in full so couldn't just check out & move. The room "A Luxury King Spa Guest Room" did not have a bath or a balcony as we'd been lead to believe it would. When I checked at the front desk about this was told very abruptly & rudely that we'd have to pay $100s more for this than we'd paid. We paid just under Â£2000 for 6 nights & thought this was not to be sneezed at as she suggested. She never did get back to us if a room with those items did become available. We then discovered that the toilet did not flush so had to ask for someone to repair it. In the middle of our first night there was loud shouting & running in the corridor, then the fire alarm went off 3 times. Everyone else on our floor were also up and asking what the problem was. I phoned down to reception to find out if this was a real alarm and was told curtly that this had been reported already and someone was dealing with it, I was then hung up on! The next morning we discovered that our hire car in the resorts private car park had a flat tyre. A coincidence? We had a view of part of the car park, complete with noisy drunks wandering through/past every night. Other complains are that on several occasions we had to ask to have our room serviced as it appeared to have been forgotten. Coffee for the machine in the room did not get replaced till we asked, also had to ask 3 times to have toilet tissue and shower caps replaced in the bathroom before getting any. We travel a lot and have never had such bad service & just general rudeness from front desk staff anywhere else. This was our 4th visit to Key West and have always had a warm welcome in other places we've stayed. This was also our 5th Wedding Anniversary holiday so extra disappointing for us to stay here. This is the only time I have ever left a review, but felt I had to say how I felt about this resort.

Reviews.Title: “Pier House is amazing!”
Reviews.Author: idaandjeff
Reviews.Content: We recently had our wedding at The Pier House and it was perfect! Both our ceremony and reception were held at the Sunset Terrace and the ocean view was incredible. The grounds are beautiful (lots of great picture spots), view was gorgeous, food was amazing and service was excellent! Our guests really enjoyed themselves and kept complimenting the food and service - everyone who worked there was extremely friendly and helpful. We highly recommend anyone looking for a Key West wedding venue to have it here - it was truly amazing and we're glad we chose The Pier House.

Reviews.Title: “Key West 2012”
Reviews.Author: Toni W
Reviews.Content: Just left the Pier House last Thursday 2/8/12. The resort is beautiful!! We had a great room (balcony with an oceanview), great service/great food, and watched a beautiful wedding on the beach right under our hotel balcony. I would recommend this resort and spa to everyone!! Thank you Pier House for a wonderful vacation!! We will be back next year.

Reviews.Title: “Too many great places to try”
Reviews.Author: LTFrench
Reviews.Content: We won't be going back here. Not anytime soon, anyway. We were very disappointed to get put over on the spa side, not what we booked. Internet only worked in the front lobby. No elevators was not a huge issue but me in the morning, not pretty nor happy sitting in my bathrobe in front of what seemed like the world... Not the same as it was the first time we stayed here in 2005.

Reviews.Title: “Loved our view”
Reviews.Author: rcandkc
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 4 nights in a dock side suite. Our view was great. We felt like we were on a cruise ship. Looking out of our room and sitting on the balcony we had an unobstructed ocean view. We would wave at the people in boats going by. It was very calm and peaceful. Then we would walk out of the property to the fun chaos of Key West. The location is perfect to walk every where. We felt Key West was a combination of Bourbon Street, Beal Street (Memphis), typical Carribean port (shops), and laid back island. We enjoyed our quick winter escape.

Reviews.Title: “Secluded Spot in the Middle of it All”
Reviews.Author: mariasch
Reviews.Content: Key West is a crazy place. Hot, loud, crowded. And that makes the crowd here all the more curious..lots of older couples in their khakis and hats looking a little surprised. Mixed in with young people carrying their drinks around in plastic cups and lost souls in scraggly beards asleep on benches. And there wasn't a cruise ship docked in town when we were there. I can't imagine how loud the town gets when that is a factor. But it is a town full of history and architecture that shouldn't be missed. I was torn between staying in a guesthouse in one of the old buildings around town and in staying in a resort on the water. I think we got the best of both worlds at the Pier House. The Pier House is the original resort in town and although it is clear it has been renovated it is still funkier than the chain properties on the ocean side of the town. The interior garden area is pretty, the little beach is nice (one side is topless, although I didn't see any topless bathing) and the beach bar and restaurant is very nice. The rooms in the Bayside and Dockside buildings have to be some one the nicest in town. The Lanai suites are cute facing the interior of the garden-not very private but space is at a premium in this little town and they laid them out well given what they have to work with. Sadly we had one of four rooms that overlooked the parking lot but when a water front room became available the next evening the staff moved us without complaint. The staff here is excellent-helpful, friendly. They absolutely are one of the reasons I gave this place such a high mark. It is right near Mallory Square but when you are in the resort you feel miles away. We did the whole Key West pub crawl thing (during which I'd advise that you NOT get one of the temporary tattoos-once they smudge they are not repairable and not even a bleach pen gets rid of them) and it was fun. But the drinks are strong and the crowd gets crazy at night. I imagine there are a thousand and one stories of mishaps and guilty mornings here. On our return trip (and there will be more than one) I would scour the historical points of interest, take a yoga class, have a treatment at The Pier House spa, go to the Gardens of Key West and see the aromatherapy lady there, have a few afternoon drinks at La Te Da, watch the sunset at the pier bar then settle in back at The Pier House before the night gets going for a remorse-free and tattoo-less Key West vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of "Traditional Rooms" at the Pier House Resort”
Reviews.Author: Anne S
Reviews.Content: My sister and I stayed one night at this resort and really enjoyed the hotel and it's location. We had a cute, enclosed patio with two chairs. We were very surprised in the morning, when we opened our curtains to see a total stranger, in her pajamas, sitting two feet from our sliding doors, on the patio that we thought was exclusively ours. We later found out that some of the "Traditional Rooms" share patios with guests from another room. This type of arrangement has never occured at any other place we have stayed and, of course, we would never stay in this type of room again. Make sure that you find out beforehand what type of patio or balcony you get, so you won't have this happen to you. Most of us want our privacy and this, of course, had none.

Reviews.Title: “Great Spot”
Reviews.Author: rdb1204
Reviews.Content: Been to the Pier House many times and we think of it as the best bang for the buck. It is nice and quiet, beautiful property, and no cruise ships blocking your view........ever. It has been recently renovated and the rooms are plenty spacious. Parking is free even though you do not need a car at this prime location. The pool is heated for the cooler days and along with the hot tub, both are surrounded by beautiful trees and plants so that you can relax in almost seclusion. You are right at the end of Duval so when you want to get out to the sites and sounds of Key West, everything is there for you and very walkable.

Reviews.Title: “Forget economizing in Key West, here you will find a beautiful room, a private beach, heated pool, nice restaurants and bars on ”
Reviews.Author: WellesleyDriver
Reviews.Content: Okay, so I made a mistake thinking I could save some cash and spend a few points on a property run by a chain, which had never disappointed me before. Forget doing Key West on the cheap. Stay with one of the 4 or 5 solid, well known hotels on or near the pier. This property is at the intersection of Front and Duval Streets. Right in the middle of the great restaurants, bars and attractions, but with a private beach and a beautiful heated pool (with enough lounges for the whole crowd). We ate here during my last trip, but this time was a little disappointed that tables were no longer set all the way to the edge of the pier. Views, food and drinks were good, however, but the best meal of all is a PiÃ±a Colada at your sand chair. As I said, you'll spend some money enjoying the fabulous Key West restaurants and bars (although you can find $ 5.00 rum drinks, good music and lots of fun at places like "Hogs Breath" within easily staggering distance). This place is worth the money!

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in Key West”
Reviews.Author: T M
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at six different hotels in Key West, and this is the Best. Location is phenomenal, at the very start of Duval Street, close to everything. The grounds of the hotel are disney-esque, almost too perfect. The private beach is better than any other beach you will find on the island. Finally, the rooms are exceptional. We had a third floor room with private balcony facing west, definitely worth every penny for the memories it created!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly place to stay”
Reviews.Author: mdj5656
Reviews.Content: We just returned from Key West and had the pleasure to stay with the nice people at the Pier House Resort. The room was somewhat smaller than I expected but, very nice, clean, nice 4 poster bed and large bathroom. The chart room is a small very friendly bar located in the courtyard. Rustic would describe it, peanut shells on the floor, popcorn and lively conversation. There is another lounge and restaurant on the property if you would rather have a nice quiet drink and dinner. Located at the very end of Duval St. with excellent views of the sunsets over the Ocean. We will return. Monte

Reviews.Title: “A dream come true!”
Reviews.Author: felineluvr2001
Reviews.Content: We booked this trip in July because spending Christmas in paradise was always a dream of mine. We could not have picked a better resort! From the moment we checked in until the sad moment of check out, we were treated like royalty. Although our room was not available when we arrived ( early) they took our luggage and encouraged us to explore.We received a call when the room was ready. We had a Lanai room that was spotless, spacious and the balcony looked out on lush green foliage (which gave us extra privacy) and a turtle/koi pond. We had gotten engaged on December 6th and we were so happy at The Pier House, and with KeyWest in general, that we decided to get married while we were there. Todd the concierge (who rocks) helped that happen by getting us in touch with Cathy at The Hip Tourist, who together with Travis who did our photography, arranged a fairy tail sunset wedding in less than 48 hours. And thanks to Jamie at the Spa who did my hair and makeup, ((huge hug)) so that even at 58 years of age, I was a beautiful bride. The pool and beach were lovely, the food at the restaurant was superb and very reasonably priced, and my martinis were perfecto! Also special thanks to staff members Dimietri, Alex, Eric, Lee, Karen, Chandler, the housekeepers who fulfilled our every request, the bartender at the Chart Room, Linda our server at our wedding dinner, the beach attendents (and apologies to anyone whose name we didn't mention) for making our visit to key West so very memorable and a dream come true! If you want to come to Key West and stay at the best resort in town, please book this gem. We will be back! Pattie and Steve Hernandez

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel in the best location.”
Reviews.Author: Jonny_Doin
Reviews.Content: We drove all the way from Tampa, and got at the hotel without a reservation, which I do not recommend. The manager for the night, Rob, got us a Spa room for 3 nights, with a balcony. The room was spacious, and very quiet. The balcony has the feeling of a decadent European resort, perfect. The hotel is located at One Duval Street, virtually at walking range to anything relevant on Key West. We never used our car. Room service closes at 10pm, as pretty much else in the island. The breakfast at the restaurant by the private beach is perfect. You wish the week never ended.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible Hotel Experience”
Reviews.Author: Petelock
Reviews.Content: We just returned from five nights at the Pier House Resort and very much look forward to our return. My wife and I stayed in the Beachcomber Suite and my boys stayed in the Harbor Loft Suite. The Pier House Resort is a tropical oasis in the heart of the Key West action. From Pier House, you can easily walk to all of Key West's best restaurants and historical sights, as well as partake in the fun of Duval Street (in fact, we only used our car to go to the golf course and to go on a snuba trip). The Pier House courtyard is beautiful, with lush plantings, a decent-sized pool and hot tub, and a nice beach with swimming dock. We stayed at Pier House during the Christmas rush (the hotel was completely booked), and never experienced any trouble getting a chair. Yes, there were many people at the pool and on the beach, but it frankly didn't feel overly crowded. Be aware that Pier House is not a huge beach resort like one would find on a Caribbean island. It is a "pocket" beach resort integrated into Key West. We were impressed by the service at the resort. We had room service for breakfast a couple of times, and the food was good and prompt. The room was cleaned every day at the requested time. The concierge was very knowledgable about local activities and made parasailing reservations for us. We will always remember our time in the Beachcomber Suite. The enormous wrap-around patio gave us 180 degree water views, including an unbelievable perch to watch the sun set -- in fact, the same view as Mallory Square. The bedroom and living room were large (the bedroom has a vaulted ceiling) and tastefully furnished, with a large soaking tub in the bathroom. The Harbor Loft Suite has a bedroom in the loft area up a spiral staircase and the living area and small patio have very nice water views. The suite has 1 1/2 baths, which would make it workable for small families. In reference to previous reviews, we noticed a few teensy ants around the refrigerator, but it seems to me that it would be very difficult to keep ants out of a hotel so opened to the outside. We resolved the issue by keeping any open snacks in the refrigerator. We look forward to returning soon.

Reviews.Title: “An Oasis in Key West”
Reviews.Author: bsimosd
Reviews.Content: Although this property is in the heart of the historical district including bars and restaurants, it is a quiet, luxurious oasis with its small beach and excellent views of the harbor and beyond. There are even a couple of large iguanas which share the waterfront property! Our only critique was the extremely squeaky and relatively tall platform bed. The mattress was just fine...only when I tossed and turned (which I always do) did the bed respond with squeaks and groans.

Reviews.Title: “Fancy place, fancy prices”
Reviews.Author: Jim-Kathy L
Reviews.Content: We got a 3-day package, but my vision of sitting on our balcony watching the sunset was not to be. We could see only a little patch of ocean through the trees. It was a nice room, just not one of their better rooms. Drinks were very expensive as was, of course, their spa which we did not use. The on-site parking was nice although we never used our car because of the central location.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty nice digs.”
Reviews.Author: ramblinman
Reviews.Content: The Pier House is as good as any hotel in Key West. Nice rooms, good service, great location. Walking distance to most of the great Key West haunts. Little beach, nice beach bar. Nice pool area. No reason not to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in Key West”
Reviews.Author: Larry O
Reviews.Content: Went down for a few days for our thirty-fifth wedding anniversary. Absolutely the place to stay in Key West. The Staff, especially Debbie, was terrific. Right in the middle of all the action. Wish we could go back next week.

Reviews.Title: “Great Trip”
Reviews.Author: LWBSLB
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Pier House the first week of Decemeber and had a fantastic time. We had a Lanai King right off the garden pool area and even thought there were plenty of other people around it was never too noisy or busy. We had a 1st floor room where we could walk right out to the pool area but there was no way of securing the patio door from the outside. A minor inconvience but it would be a great addition to the hotel to have this little extra security convience. Our room was spacious and clean and the housekeeping staff did a great job. We had a small mixup with a booking at the Spa but that was quickly rectified by the staff. The beach bar had great drinks and appetizers plus it was right off the beach area. We had breakfast at the Harbor View Cafe and the quality of the food was always excellent. As others have said the closeness to Duval Street is great and we will definately stay again at the Pier House again. The best way we found to see the island is to rent a scooter. Next to the hotel parking entry is a scooter/bike rental stand and they give you a great rental rate when you tell them your staying right there at the Pier House. Same thing with many of the activities on the island, use the hotel Concierge to book and the rates were better if you ask for it.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing Stay”
Reviews.Author: Tim S
Reviews.Content: I had stayed here before and expected much more. We were given a room with a view of the back of a fence, right by the elevators and stairs; a noisy gathering place at all hours. Two TV's, but neither remote worked. Small high-def screen in the main room, but no high-def programming. Room serviced skipped us altogether on the first full day; we had to call that evening to get the room cleaned. Our last day, they had forgotten to refresh the coffee so we had to find our own. A dead worm in the shower was still there after the room was cleaned. These are mostly minor items, but this is a well-known and prominent resort. Nobody can deny that the location is great; one of the best on the island. I sent an email when we got back, detailing the problems we had encountered. It's been several weeks with no reply from Pier House.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely suprise”
Reviews.Author: Angel696
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel, but were pleased to find how close it was to all of the attractions. We only had to walk out of the hotel door onto music, bars, street entertainers, and of course view the lovely sunsets, so we did not have to use our car finding the trolleys around the island very good being jump on and jump off The Lania room we booked was very spacious, we walked out onto the heated swimming pool, and the lovely little beach that was very safe. I would stay here again if visiting Key West again.

Reviews.Title: “Wedding Weekend”
Reviews.Author: BrlDsguise
Reviews.Content: We had our reception at the Pier House and stayed there for four nights. Reception was on the Sunset Deck and our Dockside Suite was directly above it which worked out great. Not only did we have room to entertain our guests during the weekend but they had use of the room during the reception. We got off to a rocky start with them on a promised discount on room rates due to our wedding being over powerboat race weekend but it worked out for us. I would probably never spend that much on a hotel room again but under the circumstances I was happy I did it. The Dockside Suite was great - not huge but it featured a small living room which combined with the large balcony allowed us to entertain 10 - 15 guests at a time to watch the races etc. Excellent view of the powerboats which pass less than 100 feet from the balcony. We used the spa for a couples massage on an outdoor balcony upon arrival which I think will now be a must for return trips. I liked the Beach Bar, we had drinks a few times and had lunch their once. Food and room service is not overpriced as you may find at the chain resorts - we ordered in breakfast on our last day. Spent one afternoon at the beach which is about as good as you get in Key West (you don't go for the beach). Service for our wedding was excellent - everything was perfect, and the setting couldn't be beat. They held what was left of our wedding cake until the following night, then brought it to our room so we could enjoy it with some of our family the following night. Overall no hesitation to recommend for a wedding or vacation - we have reservations for a week next October. For me it is on par with the Hyatt Resort & Spa next door where we have stayed several times. Between the two of them the one with the best price would probably win out on future vacations. Price being no object the Ocean Key would be our resort of choice.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful!”
Reviews.Author: Marc C
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at the Pier House several times. It is a location that can't be beat-- right at the foot of Duval st. and on the ocean. The grounds are nicely landscaped, parking is ample and they have a killer private beach. The beach bar is great. Grab a seat, a beverage and a snack and watch the gulf. The staff is friendly and helpful. The rooms are spotless, have a tropical feel and are nicely sized. Depending on your budget, you may have a wonderful view of the parking lot or the gulf... Gulf view rooms aren't in my budget so I settle for the parking lot view. I will admit that they do a decent job of screening the view with foliage. The Pier House is a pretty high end property and they charge accordingly. Try and negotiate whatever discount you can. I've had success with a military discount and AAA. My bride is very impressed with the spa.

Reviews.Title: “family anniversary trip”
Reviews.Author: Marilyn1029
Reviews.Content: We took the family for our 40th wedding anniversary and had a great time! We had 3 rooms and the hotel was an excellent location for all activities enjoyed. The food was very good at the restaurants at the hotel. Dockside rooms are the best and the views worth the price. We felt like we were in the Caribbean but still in the states. Our 21 month old grandaughter had a good time too with the pool and the beach right at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Thanksgiving Weekend”
Reviews.Author: 1051carolinagirl
Reviews.Content: We've been going to Key West for many years and haven't stayed at the Pier House in a long time. This year we were upgraded from a junior suite to a full suite. The living room was spacious and had a full bath w/ tub and couryard balcony; the bedroom was huge with a full bath w/ shower and another courtyard balcony. We really enjoyed our stay. The location is great,just off Duval Street but still quite. There is a small beach (rare in KW) and pool with bar service. I do agree with other reviewer..it would be nice to have more shade areas at pool.We didn't need concierge service since we've been visiting for so long, but it was avaliable. We got a lot of value for our stay and would certainly try the Pier House again.

Reviews.Title: “BRIDES BEWARE!!!”
Reviews.Author: Erin S
Reviews.Content: We had the Pier House as our wedding reception for 5/11/12, until we got a phone call saying that it was double booked. After the contract is signed and deposit taken, they offer us a new location for our reception on their property (one that we had never been told of in the beginning). They were rude and did not care about compensating for their major mistake. They missed customer service 101. They treated us as though their were brides lining up for their venue and did not have any remorse. I did not have faith in them after this screw up or feel comfortable with their motives. So after the save the dates have been sent, we cancelled our reception at the Pier House. I would never give them a single penny.

Reviews.Title: “amazing views”
Reviews.Author: KLeaf65
Reviews.Content: Went down to Key West for a Birthday get together with friends. We live in South Florida, so it is an easy 3-4 hour drive. We have been to Key West many, many times. First stay at Pier House-what a great place and location. Booked an ocean view room, and glad I did! The hotel was clean, staff friendly, beds comfy and views spectacular! We ordered room service for breakfast everyday, as wanted to enjoy the room and view. The sunset from the balcony was wonderful-enough room on the balcony for a little cocktail party with friends. The hotel was peaceful and quiet. We did not take advantage of the little beach or pool, but both looked inviting. Looking forward to a return trip to Key West soon, and plan on staying at Pier House again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Setting”
Reviews.Author: MarinaJack
Reviews.Content: The City of Key West and surrounding area are incredible on their own.....but the Pier House adds an incredible touch to the area. I booked 10 rooms for my stay. 1 Tradiional room, 7 Lanai, and 2 Harbour View Rooms housing 14 family and friends. The check in staff was very courteous and helpfull. All the rooms were clean, well stocked with the standards and extras and had those overlooking the water had spectacular views.The pool and hot tub were clean and servers were around constantly paying extra attention everyone with food and drinks. Jan and Janine were perfect at the pool / beach bar. Both were extremely personable, courteous and helpful with my entire party. I cannot say enough about them. The Chartroom bartenders and patrons were always quick to invite passers by in for a drink and some great conversation.Even the parking lot attendants were there with a cheerful good morning everday. The only negative I encountered was with some of the housekeeping staff. Some and I state only some are unhappy with their postion at the hotel. There are cards attached to the doors stating the time of day you would like your room cleaned. Not one time were we accomodated. Also, I was one of two people moving out of one room to another room and asked for the linens on my bed to be changed for the new person who would be staying in the room. The housekeeper was not accomodating. But enough negativity. Want to remember my stay as the enjoyable time that it was. This was my 4th day at the Pier House and I plan to return soon. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone planning to visit the Key West area

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely beautiful!”
Reviews.Author: jtisch
Reviews.Content: Stayed here Nov. 15 and 16, 2011. Absolutely love the place. Probably one of a very few hotels in Key West, a Key West staple for 40 years, which has its own beach, situated on six acres of land on the Gulf of Mexico. Very conveniently located at the foot of the famous Duval Street and opposite notable Mallory Square. Gorgeous water views from the hotel's wraparound walkway that extends out over the water and also from the hotel's Harborview Cafe. The grounds are stunningly landscaped as tropical gardens surrounding the interior of the property, the swimming pool and a hot tub. Our well-appointed double-bed room opened onto a private, fenced in and landscaped patio that has several nice plantings. The beach is small but ample with plenty of room to swim in the Gulf of Mexico provided by a roped-off area. There are three bars: in the Beach Bar and Grille, the Wine Galley and a small Chart Room Bar that has around six seats and allows smoking. The open-air outdoor Beach Bar and Grill is nicely appointed with rustic wooden chairs and tables and an overhead to protect diners from the sun. We cannot review the food because we chose to eat elsewhere. There is a piano bar in the Wine Gallery with an entertainer Friday through Monday. Unfortunately, we missed the performer because we were there in the middle of the week. There is also a conference center, a Caribbean Spa and an Internet area that is just off the well appointed lobby. The resort also offers waterfront suites. Parking is complimentary and there is no resort fee. The Pier House is conveniently located to many of the staple attractions on Duval Street, a stone's throw from Mallory Square, and the Conch Tour Train stop is next door. There is plenty to see and do in Key West, a town with much history, literary arts and music. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise”
Reviews.Author: Debbie C
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel. It was our third visit to Key West and the first time we stayed at the Pierhouse. Room was very nice and and the view was wonderful. The staff was courteous and helpful. I would recommend this hotel to anyone traveling to Key West.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: LindaK705
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night Nov. 15th. Great location, easy walk to Mallory Square and Duval Street, cruise ship in town so busy streets but this was peaceful, very clean, pleasant staff, plenty of on site/no fee parking. On the Gulf with small beach area, pool and hot tub. Enjoyed playing cards at outside bar and breakfast at the restaurant on the deck. Great service. Also enjoyed dinner at The Rooftop restaurant nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Nice quiet venue”
Reviews.Author: Scottju
Reviews.Content: Had a late lunch here as soon as we arrived - we were only day visitors. We ate on the deck and only saw a few other customers. The service was fine and the food was good, nothing remarkable. Unfortunately it seems to be impossible to sit at a table in the U.S. without having a large huge of ice in any drink, regardless of the drink, regardless of asking for it to be kept to a small amount. Tjhe beach was unremarkable, very man made albeit quite private. The view was pleasant and the musak could almost be classified as background, thankfully. Once you step out onto Duval Street you can kiss goodbye to being able to hear yourself think. The resort looked like a nice place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Sue19711
Reviews.Content: We stayed here from Nov 4 through Nov 8, 2011. I chose this resort from the reviews on Trip Advisor and was not disappointed. We had a Caribbean Spa room and it was lovely - very spacious with a huge bathroom. The only 'disappointment' was that it faced the street and did not have a view, however with that said, it was a quiet room, the balcony was lovely and we had the calming sound of the spa hot tub directly below us. The added benefit was being able to sit on the balcony and listen to the band playing on the deck of the Rum Bar (don't worry, you can't hear anything when the doors are shut). We are planning to book for the same weekend next year!

Reviews.Title: “Noisy rooms, uncaring staff, doesn't match up to it's own hype.”
Reviews.Author: PirategirlFlora
Reviews.Content: OK, the location is great but we found the staff to be unpleasant and very uninterested in meeting simple requests. The whole place is very noisy. Give it a miss.

Reviews.Title: “Great location matched by the service”
Reviews.Author: FloridaWiltonManors
Reviews.Content: Native Floridian and 1st time to KW. Wanted to be "in the action" and not too far from Duval St. This place fit the bill - right at one end of Duval. However, don't let the closeness of Duval and the rowdiness scare you. Upon entering the grounds, you'd swear you were miles from the action - very quiet at night. Able to park the car and walk everywhere. Staff was very accommodating. Room was clean and spacious. Nice balcony where we enjoyed a glass of wine -- or two. Would stay here again without question.

Reviews.Title: “great key west location, reliable resort”
Reviews.Author: RexKite
Reviews.Content: 3rd time staying at The Pier House, best location to action/Duval Street... very clean rooms, all good, nice sized pool, great value for the price. Two thumbs up.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: TCJF
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed three nights in a 2nd floor lanai room at the beginning of Fantasy Fest. We arrived on the Key West Express ferry and did not have a car. The hotel is in a perfect location if you like to enjoy the sights & sounds on Duval Street and it's a good value compared to the other hotels located in the same area. The resort design creates a feeling of privacy with all of the foliage. The room was lovely, especially the shower. We rented a scooter for two at the rental place in front of the hotel for 5 hours at $50-60 -- great way to see the island. The hotel has a nice fitness center and it doesn't cost extra to use it. We visited their beach bar a couple of times and the rum punch is really good! The only thing I would mildly complain about is that the room air conditioner was a little noisy. We've visited Key West 4-5 times and have stayed at other hotels in the same area as well as hotels at the opposite end of Duvall -- this was our first visit to the Pier House and we will definitely try to stay there again for our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in Key West!!!”
Reviews.Author: JohnycUK
Reviews.Content: Pier House Resort and Spa has to be by far one of if not the best hotel we have every stayed at. The rooms are marvelous perfectly clean and very spacious with very new fixtures and great coffee!!! The private beach has to also be one of this hotels best features, it is perfectly maintened by the "beach boy" all day long - not a single twig was left on it. Great cocktails and the food - AMAZING. All in all i would rate this hotel 20 out of 10 and cannot wait for our next visit. We were told many times by locals and people we met in Key West that Pier House is classed as the best hotel on the island and there is no question that this is true. Thanks for the perfect Holiday Pier House.

Reviews.Title: “Conveniently Located”
Reviews.Author: WilZu
Reviews.Content: By far the nicest hotel we have stayed in when in Key West. A little pricey, but the beauty of the entire complex is worth the price. The Chart Room Bar, which is tucked away in the center of the complex, has great character and history and the bartenders are the friendliest on the island. The private beach and pool area are a welcome oasis after a day of bar hopping and the location is within easy walking distance to all of our favorite attractions. One of the best reasons to stay here is that it is one of the few hotel complexes to have adequate, convenient and secured parking.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location!!”
Reviews.Author: JessieBeth
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Pier House two times now and I absolutely love it! Sure, it's not the cheapest place on the island, but the rooms are beautiful, clean, comfortable. It is so quiet inside the rooms and the curtains are black out, allowing you to sleep in after a long night on Duval Street. Aside from the eastern European woman at the pool bar (who told us that she had many more opportunities in her country, but that the weather was "ok" in Key West), all the staff go out of their way to accommodate you. I love the mix of people I've met and always have great conversations with locals and travelers alike. Although on this trip the pool was too cold to swim, having an ocean side salt water pool is great and last time you couldn't get me out of it!! And I don't care if it's outdated, it's a pool with comfortable chairs and fluffy towels! Even at max capacity, it doesn't feel like you are crowded and on top of each other, which is great. Last time we stayed, we rented a car and drove in from Miami. There was plenty of parking for us to leave it sit all week. This time we flew directly in and rented scooters the entire time. This is absolutely the way to go! There is a scooter rental place right at the end of the driveway and their rates are pretty reasonable. Also, we had some difficulties with a scooter and they were more than happy to trade it in for us. The location is really fabulous, as well. you are right ON Duval street and there is no shortage of sights to see, be it landmarks, bars, restaurants, or people. The Rum Barrel across the street has great food, The Conch Republic a few blocks over offers my favorite dishes, and you can get great drinks at any place you choose! Louie's Backyard is my favorite for watching the sunset as you tie one on, but that is about a mile away. I feel that you really get your money's worth out of the Pier House. I will be returning again and again!! I miss it already :(

Reviews.Title: “All about location”
Reviews.Author: monkeypants08205
Reviews.Content: The positives- location, beautiful grounds, friendly staff, reasonable rates and easy parking. The negatives- the pool is dated, the beach, while convenient, is not worth it, go to Ft Zachary instead, would have been a higher rating if I didn't spend a night at Ocean Key next door and saw the difference in property.

Reviews.Title: “Guess it wasn't so obvious...”
Reviews.Author: turtleRose
Reviews.Content: We booked our stay at Pier House for a Monday and Tuesday night in a harbor view junior suite. When we arrived we were greeted and were helped to our room with our luggage. The view was wonderful and the room was wonderful. We stayed during a 4-5 day rain that swept over southern Florida so we decided to hop online to check out what we could do instead of the beach; well here is where the trouble starts: the internet was in and out pretty consistently. So we left the room and just wondered around. Don't plan to eat at the hotel later than 10:30 because they kitchen is closed!! The day we checked out Wednesday we called down to the front desk to make sure everything was ok and we didn't need to come by there before we left and they said we were good to go. So we got in our Gallant and drove out to Front St (which if you stay on the harbor side is the only apparent way to get out) which was flooded but only looked to be a few inches covered... as soon as we got out onto Front St. water went over our car and we barely made it to the Conch Tour Train Station. When we called the front desk back for help they made is seem like we were stupid and it should have been obvious that we should not have left. Well seeing as how we are guests at your hotel and spending roughly $400/night on a room taking that kind of attitude should not be the first thing out of your mouth. The only person at the hotel that helped the situation was Bill he apologized for the staff and promised to correct their behavior... he also helped us out with a room that night seeing as how we were stuck on the island another day. However I would never go back to Pier House nor would I recommend it to friends or family!!

Reviews.Title: “Overall, very nice...”
Reviews.Author: SumBeach_1
Reviews.Content: Have been to Key West annually for about the last decade. Best feature of this Resort is location. It is in the heart of the action. Everything can be done on foot. Bar staff was very nice and food was decent. Did not indulge in a Spa this time around to provide feedback. Stayed in a Lanai room that actually had a view of the Ocean. Room was small but no big deal. Room was clean and bed was comfy. Room was directly above the Bar which did ad some noise. That said, it did not bother my wife or I. Only real complaint was the maid service was average at best. We used our glasses on the first day and they never got replaced. We also phoned the front desk about our radio not working (iPod Dock), to which we were told they would be right up. 3 days later we checked out and they had still not shown up. Beach area is small but is in line with all other Resorts of this nature. Property in general was very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Restuaraunts and Environment - but some nasty issues.”
Reviews.Author: LcBart123
Reviews.Content: Spent a week in the Pier House recently after previous trips to Key West staying in hotels/resorts further out from Duval St. The resort itself is great, they had just completed reconstructing the pool area, the beach was very nice, and the room itself while small, had a very nice view of the gulf and the beach. The resturaunts in the resort were very good, and we particularly enjoyed the Chart room. A few issues though the firsat was minor - the WIFI did not work during our whole stay. Not a big deal since this kept me out of touch with work which was probably a good thing. The second was major and will keep me from going back. On the sixth day of our stay I was awakened by a loud groaning, moaning series of noises from outside our patio doors at 5:30 am. When I looked outside I was amazed to see an overweight, middle aged couple having sex outside our room on the beach. I turned on the patio light, they didn't care. Opened and slammed the patio door, they didn't care. Amazingly this did not wake my girlfriend up, but I know from past experience that if I had used the phone - I would have woken her. This went on for two hours. So I wrapped the pillow around my head and tried to sleep to no avail. Later in the day I asked the front desk if Security patrolled the grounds and they said they did, and I explained what had kept me up. Their answer was that I should have called the desk. Big help.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Place to stay in Key West”
Reviews.Author: Keith W
Reviews.Content: My wife and I researched many places to stay in Key West to celebrate our 20th anniversary. The Pier House was a great place to stay. You are in the heart of Key West, one block from Mallory square going in one direction, 2.5 blocks from the harbour (great places to eat) and right on Duval St. Our room was in the "Spa" building, large balcony with a semi-view of the water. Side balcony looked out to the water. Large shower with a waterfall head, you could really relax. Room was large and bright. Having a beach at the facility was great, you could go to the pool or Gulf without having to travel. The beach is not large but we did not have any problems finding a perfect place to sit in the sun. Staff at the beach set up chairs and towles for you, this was a nice touch. The pool was just recently re-opened after the pool deck was replaced. One nice thing about the pool deck, you always had sun this area was not shaded by buildings. Food was ok, the Cuban French Toast for breakfast you have to try, this was really good! (had the French toast on a couple of days)The grounds had outstanding landscaping.

Reviews.Title: “Keep on looking!!”
Reviews.Author: Michelle A
Reviews.Content: First time visitor to Key West, we spent 5 nights at the Pier House Resort. When we first arrived our first room wasn't even big enough to breath, the pictures on the internet are deceiving. I must say after we complained they did give us a bigger room at an extra cost. The pool was closed for the first part of the week for renovations, I never received a notice telling me that it would be closed. Their WI FI was down all week every time I would ask about it they would say yes still down. As we walked around the town we saw many many hotels that offered a better view and looked nicer. So if your looking for nice view spacious rooms keep on looking!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great!!!”
Reviews.Author: BreazyRae
Reviews.Content: Wonderful place to stay. Perfect location at the end of Duval Street walking distance to all the bars and the sunset pier which is a great place to grab a bit to eat and a drink and people watch while watching the sun go down. We got an ocean view suite, which was amazing. Beautiful view to balconies overlooking the ocean. It was a nice place to wind down at night. The room was very clean and very spacious, big bathroom with a huge shower. The place has its own little (very small) private beach which was a nice place to go swimming and hang out for a bit. Thereâ€™s a bar right next to it where I got a really good breakfast ever morning. I wouldn't stay anywhere else in Key West, this place is just perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it loved it loved it!”
Reviews.Author: NadeneDudley
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for three nights with my bf during mid to late September. We are from Australia and were travelling along the east coast of America. Everything about the stay was positive. The location was fantastic, you walk outside and you are at the end of the main street. We loved the private beach and also the Charter bar. The room was fantastic, especially the shower. Free wi-fi internet was handy. It really completed our holiday! The only thing negative I could say was there was no free breakfast but the plenty of places to eat and the restaurants there are fantastic and reasonably priced.

Reviews.Title: “So happy I chose the Pier House!!”
Reviews.Author: oceanrunninggirl
Reviews.Content: My husband and I visited Key West for the first time and after lots of research I chose the Hyatt but it was sold out..I asked the TI forum for a suggestion and found out the Pier House is next door to it. Checkin was fast and they even upgraded us. The room was very beautiful...reminded me of the many British Colonial style Carribean Plantations I have stayed in. (White plantations shutters..big beautiful deck with comfy chairs..beautiful bathroom). We spent the day on the private beach and loved it! The water was sooo warm and there were plenty of chairs..they even let guests put the chairs in the water...everyone there was having a great time and friendly. We met some great people and enjoyed seeing the town with them. They told us they have been to every hotel in Key West and only go to Pier House now because it has the best beach and the best atmosphere...and location. The hotel is right on Duval and we walked to everything. Key West itself is a little too busy for me but the Pier House is just right. Loved the sunset...the pool was fun too but the beach was the best. I walked the Hyatt and in my opinion it didnt compare at all.. Just one suggestion I would make...I am used to the Westin Heavenly beds,,the bed was a bit hard...everything else was perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location!”
Reviews.Author: janetlorraine
Reviews.Content: My sister and I planned our first trip to Key West for several years before we were finally able to go. Growing up in the Midwest, being by the ocean is still a luxury for us and that was a major factor in selection of a hotel. Our most important criteria was a room with a balcony that would provide a beautiful view of the water. We also wanted to be in walking distance of the older part of Duval Street. The Dockside Suite we stayed in gave us all that. There was so much to enjoy in Key West but we hurried back to be on our balcony at sunset. The view was spectacular! Many of the hotel's rooms wouldn't have the view ours did and wouldn't provide the feeling of being on your own island. Our balcony was so clear, there didn't seem to be a barrier between us and the water. We were surprised to discover the Dockside Suites were not ground level. From the photographs on the website, it looked like we could go out on our deck and dangle our feet in the water. Instead, there is a restaurant and a gathering area on the first level. I'm very glad I read reviews here and talked with the hotel before booking the room or I'd have been disappointed. Going into the suite, the first room is the bedroom and it is a little small. It did have room for everything necessary and my sister said the bed was wonderful. The linens looked new and the whole suite was very clean. There was a TV and coffee maker across from the bed and several shelves close to the TV. There was a tiny refrigerator (about the size of a microwave) on one of the shelves. The room didn't have a microwave, which surprised me. The lights were brighter than a lot of hotel lights, which was a big plus. The bedroom doesn't have a view.at all. Just past the bedroom was the bathroom on the left and a large closet on the right that contained a safe. The bathroom was a little roomy and there was a small TV mounted on the wall. I would have appreciated the TV more if the bathroom had had a tub. It had a roomy shower with an area to sit. The water felt like there was a little too much water softener or something oily in it and the shower head wasn't really adjustable to make the spray harder. Because of that, it was hard to get soap rinsed off and not feel there was a film left on the skin and hair. The last room was the living area, with a sofa bed and several chairs, a TV and floor to ceiling windows making up half the wall on the end. Pulling back the curtains, we could see a gorgeous view of the water and the endless balcony the website talked about. I slept on the sofa bed and it was very uncomfortable. The mattress was thin and I could feel the metal bars. The balcony had a set of plastic mesh loungers and chairs with little tables similar to those you'd have by a pool. They were very comfortable and the mesh fabric was a help in the high temperatures. We had a wonderful view of both sunsets and sunrises from the balcony and loved hearing and watching the boats go by. The hotel has a small swimming area with sand to the right of our room but being on the top floor kept our room quiet. At night, the harbor lights for the other hotels and the piers were beautiful. We only ate at the hotel restaurant once and were disappointed. The service was slow, even though we were the only customers inside and there were few customers outside. Part of my order was missing, so I had to wait longer for that to be corrected. We finally decidedto take the rest upstairs. When we got upstairs, I found my main course was inedible. The manager did take that portion of the meal off our tab, but that was it. The hotel staff was very friendly and the requests we made for room location were honored with no problem. When checking out the bill was accurate, including the adjustment for my dinner. The hotel is located at the end of Duval Street, and the Key West Trolley is just a short walk away. The trolley is a good way to see Key West, as you can get on and off as much as you like. The drivers were very entertaining and full of info about Key West history. When we got trolley tickets, it was buy a day pass, get another day pass free. If the Key West Shuttle schedule fits yours and your plans don't require you to have a car, you might want to consider taking it if you're flying into Fort Lauderdale or Miami. Their service was great, with not many pick ups or drop offs between the airport and the city of Key West. Both drivers stopped about halfway to give people a short break and refuel. We were able to pick up some necessities, too, so that was helpful. We had a wonderful time and know we'll go back to Key West. We aren't certain we'll go back to Pier House, as room service breakfast and a comfortable second bed are more important to us than we realized. Having a tub is good, too, and that wasn't something we thought to ask about. I'm attaching photos of the suite, the balcony and the view. ( I will attach some of tthem now and some later after the review is accepted) It won't let me attach many to this review at once. My ratings are averaged (ie, the real bed was great but the pull out sofa bed wasn't).

Reviews.Title: “Heaven”
Reviews.Author: 1luluFortLauderdale
Reviews.Content: My husband and I love this property!!!! We have been here three times and never tire of it. The room service is great, never had a problem, the staff is excellent and the atmosphere at the beach bar and grille is great, the bartenders are also great, very friendly and never had to wait for service. The location of the property is perfect, right in the middle of it all, everything you could want to do is right here or not far away. Housekeeping is excellent also, the room was always clean with plenty of towels and just ask and you shall receive.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and great Rooms”
Reviews.Author: dlgreenwood35
Reviews.Content: Friendly staff, nice pool, small beach @ hotel but nice. It was great that the pool was open all night. Easy parking. They are currently doing renovations on the hotel and I thought it was easy to find a parking place considering the renovation. Rooms were very nice and the pillows were awesome!! Staff helped with anything we needed. I would recommend this hotel. It is also right there on Duval Street. In the middle of everything!!!

Reviews.Title: “Best location great room and service”
Reviews.Author: cazu247
Reviews.Content: We spend the Labor Day weekend and recieved a free up grade the staff and the service was great and the location is the best in the keys. They include free parking.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel in Paradise”
Reviews.Author: tripmiss
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel. Stayed at the end of Duval St. where all the action was, but would never know it once we entered our vacation retreat. Grounds were beautifully landscaped with lots of tropical plants. They had a wonderful piano bar and great restaurant overlooking the gulf. Our room was spacious. While we didn't have a balcony, we overlooked the garden which was very nice.The property had a small sandy beach which was perfect. Beach personnel set up your lounge chairs and table, and provide towels. There's a beach bar and cafe right there. Two nice features are they don't charge a daily resort fee and parking is free. This will be our place to stay in the future.

Reviews.Title: “PERFECTION”
Reviews.Author: GeeHBee
Reviews.Content: This hotel was absolutely perfect. Perfect location -at the far end of Duval Street, close enough to enjoy the hoop-la but far enough away to have peace & quiet when you need it. Also, it was easy to walk to any restaurants or attractions that we wanted to visit. Perfect rooms and amenities - comfortable beds,spacious bathroom with a huge shower with a bench, plenty of towels, nice array of toiletries. Perfect staff- very friendly and helpful with suggestions of places to go. Perfect little beach- if you don't feel like traveling to go to a larger one. There are beach staff who will set out your chairs and provide you with a table and towels & you can order drinks and food from the nearby cafe. But it is tiny and I imagine it might be a bit cramped during busy season (we went in August). There's also a nice sized pool. . Overall, this hotel will not disappoint. I highly recommend it and would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “High bill but poor quality! Stay Away!!”
Reviews.Author: B L
Reviews.Content: We suggest to avoid this place. Dirty room and air conditioning system old and very noisy (impossible to sleep). Low quality shutters and curtains: impossible to prevent the light from spreading all over the room early in the morning. We have paid for high quality structure and received low quality standard. The location is the only good feature.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely nice Hotel and Staff”
Reviews.Author: later
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel was really a plus. The room was very nicely furnished and maintained. The landscaping throughout the grounds was lush and made everything seem cooler. I would advise getting a Lanai Room so that you have a small patio. The restaurant was a bit expensive but there are so many places within walking distance that it did not matter. i loved this hotel :)

Reviews.Title: “Incredible location!”
Reviews.Author: funhunterEdgartown
Reviews.Content: Right in the midst of Key West..... Great accommodations and service. Can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Our favorite hotel”
Reviews.Author: AnnaS14
Reviews.Content: This was our 5th stay at Pier House and I think itâ€™s getting better and better every time. The location is just the best, our room was quiet and spacious and the staff as nice and attentive as ever. We prefer the 2nd floor of the Caribbean Spa building, with the â€œgarden viewâ€�. We are not party goers, and we come to KW mostly to relax, explore its history and nature, so a quiet hotel is the must. Some of our happiest memories are just sitting at the balcony at night, sipping a drink, watching the stars and talking about everything and anything - why there is never time for that at home? There is a terrace at the back, behind the restaurant, from which you can watch sunset if you donâ€™t feel like joining crowds on Malory Square. The rooms and the grounds are meticulously maintained, and - unlike in many other hotels - there are always hotel employees around, both outside and in the hallways, adding to the sense of security. This is most definitely a hotel for grown ups - no spring breakers, hardly ever any rowdy inconsiderate guests - but I wouldn't hesitate to recommend it to people with children who would be able to sleep at night undisturbed. Iâ€™ve never ordered a room service but we always have at least one dinner at their Harborview CafÃ© (small menu, everything well prepared and very tasty) and a drink at the Piano Bar where performers are often joined by several talented locals and where you can get a strawberry daiquiri of incomparable deliciousness. Oh yes, and if you need to work while you are there (dreadful but sometimes inevitable) the free wi-fi really works very well! The only â€œconâ€� I can think of is that Pier House further contributes to the disease commonly known as â€œmissing Key Westâ€� that many visitors bring home with them.

Reviews.Title: “By Far the Best Resort in Key West!!”
Reviews.Author: nocurfu53
Reviews.Content: Went down to Key West for the 7th straight year to enjoy Lobsterfest on Duval Street. Every year we try a new Hotel or Bed & Breakfast. We will stop trying new places after staying at the Pier House. Check in was a breeze. We got upgraded to an Oceanfront Room. View was incredible. Room was beautiful. Bathroom was very roomy. Bed was so comfortable. The staff was so friendly and helpful. The pool is not huge but nicely laid out. The Beach is small and has a raft about 30 feet offshore you can swim to and lay out on. One side of the beach some Girls laid out topless. Its very private. The location of this Resort is perfect for everything. Close enough to Duval but far enough away not to get all the noise. All the food and drinks we had there were great! We will never stay at another Key West Resort. We found our Paradise here at the Pier House.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic base for exploring Key West - Amazing views”
Reviews.Author: MikeManchesterUK
Reviews.Content: On arrival at the hotel I was a little disappointed it was quite late but the receptionist was on duty on her own and we ended up having to search for our rooms with our bags. First impressions were that the corridors were a little drab and so our spirits weren't that high. However, on reaching our room all negative thoughts disappeared. We had booked one of the dockside suites and I must say it was worth the extra. We had a spacious bedroom and a separate sitting room that looked straight out over the bay towards Sumset Key - and that was very appropriate as the sun was just going down and there was the most amazing sunset. We used the beachside bar for snacks and thought the beach was fantastic - the guy who looks after the beds was really great and very helpful. The pool is small but adequate and our teenage boys liked that it was open 24 hours a day. Having looked at the alternatives whilst we were there we would definitely stay in the same hotel if we were down that way again.

Reviews.Title: “Awful and RUDE!!!”
Reviews.Author: cassie o
Reviews.Content: Tried to celebrate Mom's 80th there. Parking lot view comes w/all traditional rooms per mgr named Rob. Rude service 24/7. Toliet broken, roaches and 7 inch creepy worm in room! AWFUL! Cassie Ostrander

Reviews.Title: “Pier House in Key West is EXCELLENT!!!”
Reviews.Author: CrazyboutKeyWest
Reviews.Content: We arrived around noon, and although I had been told I was written in as an early check-in, I had to wait two hours for my room. We stored our bags and went to lunch. It was annoying, but that went away once we saw the room. OMG, I couldn't believe how beautiful it was. I had reserved a Lanai Room, and there was an amazing patio with a lush garden right outside. The pictures really do them no justice. The bathroom alone was worth the wait. The mattresses were firm and THICK with several layers of bedding on platform beds. I can see how someone might not like the firm mattresses, but as someone with a bad back, I loved it. The Harbour View Cafe was great. We arrived for breakfast every morning, and I tried something different every day. I also enjoyed ordering room service and was always surprised how fast they got there. The private beach was excellent. There were no umbrellas, but there was a HUGE shady area to make up for that. The pool was small and not too appealing, but I can't see using a pool when there's a private beach available so it didn't really matter. The service was excellent. Everyone there was on their 'A' game. Housekeeping doesn't usually get around to the rooms till mid-afternoon, but when you're on vacation, who really cares? I usually just tell them to give me fresh towels and leave the room the way it is. Hey, I'm on vacation and could care less about the bed being made. On the day we were leaving, I had told them I'd be leaving later than the usual check-out coz my flight wasn't till 7 PM. I was told that morning that they were completely booked, and I'd have to leave by 1 PM, the latest. I asked if there were ANY other rooms available, but I was told no by the front desk. Again, annoying, but it got fixed. I went into the manager's office (Eric), and he found us a room in the Caribbean Spa building that I could move to immediately and stay till 5 PM. It was perfect. The room had a King bed and a huge balcony. We'd been in the spa building the day before to get massages. We now had time to kill, and so we got another massage and a facial. I was so grateful to have had the opportunity because the spa staff is OUTSTANDING. EVERYONE THERE IS OUTSTANDING!!!

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location!”
Reviews.Author: Ali_law71
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Pier House for my fiance's 40th bday. Great location - steps to Duval Street and Marina. This hotel has its own (but small) beach. The room was decorated nicely. The spa is great as well. I'd highly recommend staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful resort and great service”
Reviews.Author: Sally R
Reviews.Content: The Pier House Resort and Spa is amazing! This place is extremely clean and provide great customer service! I have already suggested this resort to my friends and family. This was also our first time to Key West. I got married on Smathers Beach June 2, 2011. It was a small wedding, but it was wonderful! Pier house accommondated me and my Groom like we were special guest (as they seemed to do with all their guest). We plan to come back on our three year anniversary. The Pier House Resort is where we will be staying. Thank you, Pier House Resort for all your accomondations that make you stand out from all the others! The staff were patient and helpful with giving us directions to local restaurants and other places of interest. I highly reccommend this Resort!!!

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular”
Reviews.Author: Natty Q
Reviews.Content: If anyone has something bad to say about this Resort they just want to complain. My husband and I stayed here for our honeymoon from August 8-12, 2011. First off we booked the traditional room and upon arrival we received a free upgrade to the Caribbean Spa Rooms. The bathroom was very clean. No carpet. Wooden floors. Flat screen TV's. Plush King size bed and sofa. The shower could fit more than 2 people, although it was only the 2 of us (honeymoon time). The hotel was very quite and relaxing. The private beach was small but very clean and was not over crowded. I went to the beach early in the AM and late afternoon and had no problems finding a space to sit down. The hotel provides beach towels for you as well. Room Service was fast and accurate. The only reason why I did not give it 5 stars is because it is very expensive to eat at the resort, so take some time to venture out. I will not stay anywhere else when I go back. Oh and the view of the sunset was beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: MDGal66
Reviews.Content: The Pier House is a very nice hotel with an excellent location. Just steps from Mallory Square and Duval Street so you don't need a car. We walked everywhere --- even to 2 restaurants that were at the other end of Duval in very residential neighborhoods. The private beach is great, and the food in the hotel restaurants was very good too.

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular Views and great accommodations”
Reviews.Author: hofmanb
Reviews.Content: My wife and I booked the Pier House in Key West for a 3 night get-a-way and chose the most expensive room available. The Dockside Suites are at the end of the hotel, right on the water and have floor to ceiling glass windows with spectacular views of the sunset and all of the water activity of the busy bay. We overlooked the colorful dock that has music every night during sunset. The suite had a wrap around patio with lounge chairs and we had wine every night (we brought our own and the refrigerator in the room was perfect for keep it cool). The suite was very quiet and when all doors were closed you could not hear any music or noise - perfect for sleeping. The location is perfect as it is at the end of Duval Street and close to any area you want to visit. We parked the car (free) and never moved it until we left. The hotel has a small beach and a beautiful pool plus several bars and a nice restaurant where we had breakfast one morning. Coffee is available for free from 6:00 to 9:00 each morning plus there is a coffee maker in the suite. The suite and entire complex was very clean and had many shrubs, trees and plants which gave it a very nice atmosphere. It was worth the money and we highly recommend the Dockside Suites.

Reviews.Title: “In the hoopla,then out of it!”
Reviews.Author: Rbmsh
Reviews.Content: Pier House allows you all of Key West within walking distance and an isolate luxury quite place to get away from it all!

Reviews.Title: “Adore this place!”
Reviews.Author: TravelAbroad09
Reviews.Content: This place is a gem amongst many hotels in Key West. THe man-made beach was a dream and we spent hours out there relaxing in the sun and cooling off in the water. The beach staff are absolutely amazing - friendly, prompt, and eager to help. Walking distance to anything you might want or need in Key West. Clean rooms, lush grounds, super friendly beach staff who are worth their weight in gold! We had a wonderful experience at Pier House and will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: roaminggnome00
Reviews.Content: This was our second time at Pier House. Very nice hotel and great location-on Duval Street. Pier House has a beach with an area where you can swim in the gulf. We stayed in a Caribbean Spa room-awesome. The spa rooms are really big and we had a private balcony. The AC was set so that it could not go lower than 74, but they have nice ceiling fans. No elevator in this building, though, so if you're on the second floor-get a bellhop to bring your luggage up! All of the staff are super friendly-they smile, tell you hi, and hold doors open for you. Would definitely stay here again and would recommend Pier House to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful and Spacious”
Reviews.Author: TennesseeTravelQueen
Reviews.Content: We've stayed in many hotels in Key West and this was one of our favorites. We had a 1 bdrm. 2 bath suite overlooking the gardens and pool with a small view of the ocean. The room was clean and very comfortable. They have a fun bar/lounge on site and restaurant. They also have a small private beach area. You only have to go a few blocks to be at the center of the action on Duval St. and lots of great restaurants. Next time I will try the spa services.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and great hotel in Key West!”
Reviews.Author: europeantravlr11
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Key West. The Pier House is in the perfect location in Key West to get around the main parts of the island. Although the island is small, I am glad we stayed close to the action in order to limit our transportation costs on the island (cab, moped, etc.). The hotel was roomy and the staff was courteous. During our stay, the hotel was busy but quiet. They allowed us a late check-out, and held our bags after that for a late flight. The man-made beach area is nice, and large for a Key West beach (Key West does not have a big beach scene). We stayed in a lanai king. It came with a mini-fridge and a small keyless safe. The room and bathroom were large. The hotel is located at 1 Duval Street, so when you exit the parking lot on foot, you are right next to the clubs and stores of Duval Street and the sunset celebration at Mallory Square. It is very easy to navigate Key West from this location, and it makes is easy to walk back to the room for pit-stops during the day (Key West in July is very hot and humid!).

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME resort and convenient location”
Reviews.Author: RAKfromMD
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Pier House for 3 nights before heading to Fort Lauderdale for a cruise. I had been reading tripadvisor and the many reviews of places in Key West.
