The staff is professional, the setting peaceful, the Vichy shower amazing, and the body treatment luxuriating. The champagne afterward was especially delightful. This was my first time enjoying a treatment at Pier House...but not the last. Btw, the lovely lady who gave me my treatment was Cecily. A couple of evenings prior, we had a drink at the Wine Galley Piano Bar. It was a wonderful atmosphere, dimly lit, the pianist crooning, and the bartender amazing. The gentleman was "chief, cook, and bottle washer". He poured drinks, waited tables, cleaned up the tables, etc. He ran around and did so very well...in the midst of this, my friend asked him a question and at no time did he give the vibe "Dude, I'm busy here" (not that he should have, but if this guy was under stress, you never knew it). The Saturday night manager came in and made a comment about a table that had not yet been cleaned up...I personally wanted to shake this Jerk Ball Mgr and say "Do you NOT recognize this man is doing everything? He WILL get to the table". Despite that, we will visit Wine Galley again...it's a lovely place to start *or* end your evening if you aren't there to dine.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: wicky144
Reviews.Content: This is a 3+ star hotel in an excellent location. Close to duval and Mallory pier. We originally had a lanai room but with a $ at check-in we're upgraded to a harbor view, loft room. The view was terrific. The hotel has a small beach but it and the pool area are small enough that it gets pretty crowded. The proximity of the beach grill and bar is nice but overall the food is average. Tucked out of the way is a little place full of history and fun called the chart room bar. Their wifi system and cable tv systems both needed help and upgrades---they were the same provider.

Reviews.Title: “A little slice of heaven!”
Reviews.Author: twiggers77
Reviews.Content: This hotel is just a little slice of heaven! It was located right at the end of Duval Street, but close to all the action. Onsite parking was free! They have their own private beach area, plus a swimming pool if you don't like salt water. The rooms were phenomenal! Very spa like atmosphere and a huge patio/balcony area. We would stay here again in a heartbeat....the only downside was that they weren't pet friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: DavidSpringfieldVA
Reviews.Content: Just a great stay! My wife and I enjoyed our honeymoon at Pier house in 2007 and have been back each year since. Always staying in room #609. A large comfortable room with a whirlpool and king size bed and 3 french doors 2 opening onto a large balcony. This year we had a couple minor problems with the internet not working all the time in our room (#609) again. I went to the front desk to ask if anything could be done to boost the signal or whatever. The front desk manager apologized asked if it would be ok to move us to a different room, being partial to the room we honeymooned in I said I would like to see the room first. We were put into a two room suite with two bathrooms and a wet bar. the room (619 was twice the size and just as lovely as the first. All at the same price! The staff of the Pier house are nothing but professional and helpful. The resort is in the best location in Key West at the end of Duval street and next to Mallory Square where the Sunset celebration takes place. They have one of the few sandy beaches in the keys and the attached pool and restaurant and bar will let you enjoy the beach and pool while also enjoying the excellent wait staff bringing you great food and drinks as well as live music most of the day! The spa is also a great place for massage and other pampering services! They have scooter and bike rentals on the property and the restaurant will even cook your fresh caught fish for you if you catch a keeper. Wave runners and boats and sea trips can all be rented next door and many restaurants are all a short walk away. Ambrosia for sushi and Pepi's or Columbian Grace for breakfast are our recommendations!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay, Just Don't get a Massage”
Reviews.Author: BerkshireBeck
Reviews.Content: My stay at the Pier House in general was everything I had expected- great location, friendly staff, well appointed room.Everything was lovely, except for the massage I got at the spa. My masseuse talked through the whole experience, about his dear friend Sandy Bullock, his divorce, his old jobs, and various sundry items that had nothing to do with me or the massage I was having. He did not even ask if I had any pre-existing conditions he should know about (which I do) and to top it off, the only reason I knew the whole thing was over was that he told me to be careful getting up and then I heard the door shut. I admit, I did not voice my exasperation and utter disappointment at the time- being stunned by the utter lack of professiuonalism and that the experience had really been that bad. But having just paid one of fellow travelers for this part of the bill, I am incredibly irked that I have to pay over $100 for an experience that left me stiff and irritated instead of relaxed and rejuvenated.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, gorgeous room w/view, tasty food, fabulous spa, good service”
Reviews.Author: Sirisly
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel for our 10th anniversary well in advance because I absolutely wanted a harbour view room and feared they would sell out. I wanted every possible amenity for a fairly short stay and they had it. As it got close, I noticed they were running specials that we qualified for. I had already put down a deposit, but they changed my reservation to a package that included breakfast and massages plus a little bit of a break on the rate. They didn't have to do that, but they did and I am eternally grateful. Our harborview room was great... not huge but spacious enough for 2. Our second floor balcony had a nice view with lots going on, but don't expect expansive panoramic views. I suppose we could have gotten a dockside suite for that or asked for a higher floor perhaps. Bed was comfy, sheets of reasonable quality and a decent flat screen for watching in-room movies. Bathroom was nice w/a spacious shower. Water pressure wasn't great, but certainly good enough. We had breakfast on the house every morning at the Harborview Cafe. The food here was excellent. Hotel dining is expensive. It could have easily run us $40 or $50/day just for breakfast so I was very pleased to have this included in our package. Besides the food, the view was also great. This routine was a truly outstanding part of our stay. The grounds were lush and beautifully landscaped. The small private beach was well-kept, as was the pool, though we didn't take advantage of either. The spa was professional and clean, staffed with wonderful people... no teeny boppers fresh out of massage school. I wish I had the time for a full spa day! Finally, there's the location, which cannot be beat. You're right at the end of Duval Street, next to Mallory Square and close to all the shops. You can walk to the other end or just stumble out the door and rent an electric car or bike to take you around the island. All things considered, an outstanding hotel with everything you could want... if you're willing and able to pay for it.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful!”
Reviews.Author: natrexdogg
Reviews.Content: What a great relaxing place to stay! A little pricy but well worth it. You have your own private beach which was great. This was my first trip to the keys & I did not realize that most places on the water are really not on the water! This one was & I even got to practice snorkeling before we went to the main beach. Location is great. We didn't look at the car again until it was time to leave! We walked everywhere-everything you needed was within walking distance. Will definetly go again this year.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location, Exceptional Service”
Reviews.Author: karenacoye
Reviews.Content: We received excellent service at every point - front desk, waitstaff, beach bar, beach attendant, and housekeeping - everyone we interacted with was very friendly and professional. The room was immaculate and well decorated, and we were pleasantly surprised to find 2x daily housekeeping - no sign of those post-beach/pre-dinner showers when returning home later in the evening. The food was also excellent - we had breakfasts and a beach lunch and all were fantastic - much better than we even expected. Plus, no surprise fees at check out - no charge for parking, internet or "resort fee" - although all others seem to do this. We were so glad we chose Pier House for our anniversary and will definitely return!

Reviews.Title: “Fun in the Keys!”
Reviews.Author: CloudyDae
Reviews.Content: We loved the Pier House, it's extremely centrally located (directly next to Ocean Key, a small street separating the 2 hotels) nice bedding, beautiful grounds, nice service and a great price ($199/night) was right up our alley...we only stayed 1 night and spent the rest of our stay in Islamorada, but had fun doing a pub crawl in KW and checking out the sights...the beach was a nice perk, nice, comfy bedding, a small balcony (facing the parking lot) and the restaurant was yummy for breakfast. We told the front desk it was an anniversary celebratory trip and they comped us a bottle of champagne, nice touch for our 1st stay...used it at breakfast for mimosas and they comped us the OJ as well...would definately stay again. Happy travels! :-)

Reviews.Title: “Perfection”
Reviews.Author: TheGuzmans
Reviews.Content: If you are going to stay at the Pier House you must stay in one of their spa rooms. They are in a seperate building where the spa is on the first floor. All of these rooms have recently been redone. They are large and spacious, they have wood floors which I love and they have huge luxurious bathrooms. We love the veranda/balcony - sitting out there and drinking coffee and just relaxing is the best. The Pier House is centrally located - walking distance to everything. The staff is always very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Known for great service - but nothing more than the minimum”
Reviews.Author: IllinoisProf
Reviews.Content: Slow service at peak times due to understaffing. Staff does not go out of its way for service. Don't rely on conceirge as we found recommendations to be poor. Private beach is only redeeming quality. I will stay somewhere else next time.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent resort, great location”
Reviews.Author: jly2009
Reviews.Content: Spent 4 nights here - it is a true haven within Key West. Hotel is clean, comfortable and very well maintained. The pool area and beach area are very peaceful and relaxing. We ate at the Harbour Cafe and the food was excellent. Hotel is in an fantastic location at the top of Duval Street which was very busy and touristy but once you were within the hotel grounds you weren't really aware of the noise. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay here and would recommend it to anyone looking for a relaxing stay in Key West.

Reviews.Title: “Spa is a big problem”
Reviews.Author: TravelJunkie1209
Reviews.Content: We've had problems with the spa before. Either they don't answer the phone, or they put you on hold for 15 minutes and never come back, or they simply seem unwilling to try to book what you want. It's a shame because the problem seems to be with spa management and a certain 'attitude', not with the spa employees. When you book a 'spa stay', you'd expect a little 'spa service'.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent as always”
Reviews.Author: ptldebmac
Reviews.Content: Stayed November 18th to November 22nd... We stayed there 3 times before, and will always come back...We love the location and the private small beach..the outside resturaunt is great and the food outstanding..Yes it is a little expensive but everything in Key west is expensive so get use to it,suck it up and enjoy the atmosphere. The rooms are all redone from 2yrs ago and are beautiful..The staff is so helpfull, and will do anything for you. If you do want to save some money go to Harpoon Harry's for a cheap breakfast with alot of friendly faces, they treat u like one of the locals. A very down home breakfast, not fancy but great breakfast...For Dinner go to one of the local resturaunts during early bird special...OMG great prices for the same food a little later...Two Friends Patio has a great Early Bird Special 4-6...then u can go party all night...and great smoked fish dip and lobster bisque...YUM...Cant wait to go back..I love Key West..

Reviews.Title: “Just what the Wife and I needed”
Reviews.Author: RidersUp
Reviews.Content: My wife and I needed to get away for a couple days. Never been to Key West so wanted to be in walking distance to the action. The Pier House was just the right choice. Friendly staff, never needed the car, very romantic room looking out over the water with nice balcony, clean, quiet, and while the cost was a little more, it was well worth it. When I booked the room only double queen was available but I made a note for a king if one became available and they took care of us. Will be back. PS. Two Friends Patio right next to hotel on front street is great for breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Worst "resort" on the gulf”
Reviews.Author: ChesapeakeCrabs
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Pier House 5 times in the past. The first being in 1994. The quality and the service at the resort has taken a nose dive. I booked my room for 10 days including the Power Boat Race Week last November. I requested the Deluxe Ocean Front first floor. Upon arriving (Friday)I was placed on the third floor and told I could not get the first floor until the following Thursday. I found the room to be okay, but with limited supplies. The have glass bathroom doors, so if someone needs to use the bathroom in the middle of the night the whole room is illuminated. The halls echo everyone's voices, so a good night's sleep is impossible.The balcony, sidewalks, elevators, stairwells, and pool area were filthy. They claim to have a business center which consist of one slow computer that always had someone conducting lengthly business on so that you had to keep coming back to print your boarding passes. I saw the same trash for three days in a row by the ice machine. The pool bar service was the only good service at the hotel. The front desk had a problem speaking English most of the time. For the cost of this room I expected more. I have already booked next year's stay at the Westin. The Pier House is not the luxury resort it used to be....what a shame.

Reviews.Title: “Another Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Pat D
Reviews.Content: We arrived Saturday Nov 7th for 5 nights - check-in went easy - upgraded room to the Caribbean Spa building - We really enjoy staying here (this was our 2nd time at the Pier) third time in Key West - Hotel staff are always friendly - houskeeping does a great job to include nightly turn down service - Geniene at the outside bar is one of the best bartenders in Key West - had a opportunity to watch the first day of the International Power Boat races which run right by the beach side of the hotel. Will book again for sure next year -

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely amazing”
Reviews.Author: velveta79
Reviews.Content: I just came back from Key West where I stayed at Pier House for 7 days. I absolutely loved every minute of it. Hotel is very clean, staff pleasant and views just breathtaking. I booked my flight with a hotel through expedia where I got a room with a balcony, although upon arrival I wasn't satisfied with the view-facing the pool. I upgraded my room to an ocean,. beach view for only additional 60 bucks a day. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The only negative I can say about the stay was that coffee wasn't replaced every time room was checked, so I would have to call the front desk other than that, I loved morning sun tanning on the beach where servers would come to me if I would like something to eat and drink. Prices are reasonable I must say, not expensive at all. I would love to come back in a near future. Thank you Pier House for beautiful memories. See you soon ! :)

Reviews.Title: “The Pier House was wonderful!!!”
Reviews.Author: TashainMexico
Reviews.Content: I stayed at The Pier House Resort and Caribbean Spa, Key West from Sept 14-19, 2009. I have to say, before departing I read some reviews with negative comments, and after returning, I donâ€™t understand how anyone could have a negative review of this hotel. I arrived around 6 pm on Monday and check-in was smooth and pleasant. I had booked my flights and hotel through Expedia.com and there was only one choice of room type available (basic). When I checked in I asked if I could get the best room in that price range and they gave me a nice room overlooking the center courtyard/garden with a king bed. It had easy access to the front desk, pool, restaurants, and the beach. They even had a security guard tote my bags up to the room for me. The piano bar was closed for remodeling, but everything else was in working order. The lush tropical vegetation made for a beautiful view from my balcony as well as while walking down the pathways. The air conditioning thermostat was easy to access to adjust the temperature as needed. The walk-in shower was lovely with the huge shower head suspended from the ceiling and it had a small seat. There were wonderful clean fluffy white towels in abundance. The room even had a large flat screen TV and a small refrigerator. And yes, there is a CVS Pharmacy across the street, very handy! The resort location is perfect. One block to Mallory Square, 1 Â½ blocks the other way to the Harbor/Wharf boardwalk, and easy access to the western end of Duval Street. There is also a boat tour operator right outside the property for glass bottom boat tours, sunset cruises and snorkeling trips. The only slightly negative comment I have is that the pool water temperature was HOT, not refreshing at all. I ate at the Harborview CafÃ© several times for breakfast and had snacks brought to me at the pool. Service was good, the food was great, and the view fantastic! The beach is smallish, but beaches in Key West are rare. They bring in sand from the Bahamas. The size of the beach was fine for the amount of people using it. I didnâ€™t spend any time in the cigar bar (air-conditioned and enclosed), it was too smoky for me, but it seemed nice. The concierge, Todd Berlin, was helpful when I asked questions and he helped me to confirm my outgoing flights before I left. I also used the wake-up call service, which worked fine. I never walked past the front desk when someone didnâ€™t say â€œhiâ€� and ask if they could help with something. There had been previous reviews that commented on the noise heard outside their room. I didnâ€™t hear much while the air-conditioning fan was on, but I did hear an occasional door open or close. All in all, everything was clean, comfortable, and hospitable. I just canâ€™t see why the listed room prices are $600.00 per night. The Expedia price I paid was much more like I would expect. Location=the best, service=great, price=expected

Reviews.Title: “Pier House Resort-best place and location to stay”
Reviews.Author: christyliu99
Reviews.Content: Pier House Resort was a great choice to stay at Key West. Would recommend it to anyone whose is going there for a vacation. What makes it great is its location, It is right on Duval street and walking distance to all the water activities boarding stations. I went there for my birthday and stayed one week. The staff upgraded my room to ocean view room for my birthday. Very nice of them to do so. Stayed at a great room with GREAT view of the GULF. Rooms were really clean. They have their own private beach and bar. Best of all, no resort fee, no parking fees and free wireless internet from your room. The concierge "TODD" recommended a lot of different activities and helped booking them. The price and the trips that he recommended were GREAT. Overall, CLEAN rooms, GREAT locations, FRIENDLY staff.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location in a modern, friendly facility”
Reviews.Author: BLTBoston_MA
Reviews.Content: To have both a beach and a pool in a Key West hotel, especially in the heart of the action on Duval street , is a wonderful thing. The food was very good. We especially enjoyed the lobster BLT. The fish at the beach were beautiful. No need to go to an aqarium! The staff were very helpful and the hotel itself was clean and modern. It would have been nice to have free internet, but that was our only complaint. We would definitely stay there again. Mallory Square businesses and it's sunset entertainment, jet ski rentals and boat excursions, Mel Fisher's museum, the trolley and the Conch Train were all within a block. We'd recommend the trolley as it is $29 pp for the day. It makes 12 stops and comes around every 1/2 hour. It is a great way to bar hop or sight-see. No need to rent a car here! A taxi ride to the airport at the end of your stay is only $8.00pp.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Fish929
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel. Would definitely stay here again. As far as beaches go in the Keys, theirs was excellent. Great location right on the water and on Duval Street. I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, very friendly, canÂ´t wait to get there again”
Reviews.Author: minkanicky
Reviews.Content: Very nice situated with private beach. Most friendly staff and good food. We really enjoyed our stay and canÂ´t wait to be back!!! Great hotel, great value!!

Reviews.Title: “I am spoiled now... won't want to stay anywhere else”
Reviews.Author: Acergurl
Reviews.Content: Everyone was wonderful and accommodating! Did not want for anything!! Perfect place to stay!! We had a small balcony, but it was still perfect. The private beach was one of the hi-lites when we were looking. They have waiters wait on you while you lay out! drinking Daiquiris while you sunbathe...what a life!! AHHHH. Our Bell-hop guy Lee was wonderful. We loved him!! Made our stay more enjoyable. Mallory square and all the shops/bars/restaurants were right there. We looked at the Westin also but was leary of it because it said it docked cruise ships every so often and would be in the way of the view from your room.. (they were right) We made the right choice!! Loved my vacation there. Most likely will only stay at this place again and no where else. I am spoiled.

Reviews.Title: “Everything you would ever need in one hotel.”
Reviews.Author: CSHughes
Reviews.Content: We just got back from our first time to the Keys and loved our stay at The Pier House. We stayed in on of the dockside rooms which have amazing ocean views with plenty of room. The glass balcony views were breathtaking. The small beach was clean, close to the bar, and the ocean dock was a nice touch. The pool was a little small but clean and not really much of a view. We preferred to stay on the beach. I worked out in the gym and though the equipment was adequate but a little dated. The Chart Room Bar is a really find! This is one of the oldest bars in Key West and we had fun hanging out and meeting the locals. We didn't have any trouble with the free Wi-Fi in our room. The location on Duval Street was perfect. If you don't mild walking, we could walk to almost everything we wanted to see. Our furthest walk was to the Southernmost point and it only took us 25 minutes. Mallory Square and the marina are just a 5 minute walk in either direction. We will absolutely be back to Key West and stay at the Pier House when we come back.

Reviews.Title: “Good but not great”
Reviews.Author: zmetman
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed in a Caribbean Spa room (via the the Late Riser Package) for our 3 night stay that included 2 breakfasts (which I was told over the phone when I booked the package was for room service only). We were immediately disappointed by the only somewhat helpful front desk staff. Although she was pleasant enough, she stated that we didn't have a choice of rooms as they were fully booked and just assigned us one even though we arrived before the designated check in time. Normally the earlier you arrive, the better choice of rooms you have. The bellman promptly escorted us to our assigned room which turned out to be a handicapped room. Our first thought was, why assign us this room when neither of us are handicapped? Wouldn't you want to keep this room vacant for a handicapped person? Aside from having special design features to assist the handicapped, the TV was not even placed in direct view of the bed, but was inconveniently place somewhat away from the bed and from the sitting area. We questioned the bellman about whether other rooms had the same set up and he said he really didn't know. Not very helpful. Additionally, although he was friendly enough, he was only able to marginally converse in English which just frustrated us that much more. When we called the front desk and told them they assigned us a handicapped room, the clerk seemed surprised and kept us on held for what seemed like an eternity and reassigned us to another room on the second floor. On the plus side, the new room had a far better layout, was clean, comfortable, and we were happy to have it. In the morning I looked at the coupon for the breakfast and it said that we could eat at the Harbourview Restaurant or in room. We decided to eat at the restaurant and were very pleasantly surprised. The food was very good and the portion sizes were ample. As an aside, the waiters we had for both days were foreign as well; they were very nice but were a little difficult to understand. It was great that the hotel had a little beach and a pool nearby as well. Although the beach is very small, it was still nice to have one on premises. I don't believe any of the other hotels in Old Town have one. The pool on the other hand was large enough but it was so hot we couldn't even stay in it so after the first day, we didn't even try it again. It felt like a hot tub; the water at the little beach was far more refreshing. So overall, we found the staff somewhat indifferent and in higher end hotels you expect a little more. The service was a little lacking here. The hotel has a great location, no resort or parking fees, a good restaurant, a pool and a little beach. Would we stay here again, yes, but we would at least know what we bargained for going in.

Reviews.Title: “The Pier House has declined substantially in ambiance and value.”
Reviews.Author: J_M-wanderer
Reviews.Content: We're repeat customers at the Pier House and at one time would have rated it as one of the best any place. Our last stay there has changed our perception of this resort completely. Not only has the quality of the service declined, but the overall comfort of this establishment has severely been degraded. Considering the Pier House rates, this makes this establishment not desirable. The worst of the issue with the Pier House was the tolerance for late night partying within the establishment. The "scene" in Key West has changed over the years, although in the past the Pier House maintained a higher standard. That standard has eroded to the point of questionable customer service. Both nights we were kept awake until 4 or 5 a.m. with parties directly on our floor. Although security was called several times, by several non-party rooms, the response wasn't sufficient to stop the noise. This combined with serious renovation ongoing throughout, and the completely terrible quality of food and drinks being served left us with the desire to leave as soon as possible. Although I spoke directly with the resort manager I was told there really wasn't anything they could do.

Reviews.Title: “It Just Keeps Getting Better!”
Reviews.Author: janamarlowe
Reviews.Content: I just came back from a 9 day stay at the Pier House. I have been going there for many years and this was the first time that I went totally alone, that is how comfortable everyone there makes you feel. As usual the service was excellent. Everyone goes above and beyond to make sure that their guests are happy. From the front desk to the servers - everyone is really wonderful. In addition, the food at the Harborview Cafe is better than any other restaurant that I have ever eated at on Key West and at a better prices. Why would you go anywhere else when you have the pool, beach, a great restuarant and piano bar all within a couple of hundred yards? I am already planning my next trip! Thank all of you at the Pier House for making my stay very enjoyable! - JC from Hoboken, NJ

Reviews.Title: “Good, not great. Might try a different hotel next time.”
Reviews.Author: flights
Reviews.Content: Location is good, hotel was clean, our room was clean, bathroom clean but not "spotlessly clean". The outside steps to our second floor room were worn and slippery - my husband and I tripped on the same step, different days - dry steps, not rainy or wet. Service is fair, and there is a language problem in the restaurant, the result being one didn't always get what was ordered. The front desk staff is cordial, but not particularly helpful. We were told we could buy conch train tickets at the front desk, but the clerk said, "yeah, you could get them here, but why don't you just go down to the corner and get them, it's just as easy". Easy for who? There is free use of a computer in the lobby to print boarding passes.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent in all ways!”
Reviews.Author: pupsmom
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed a the Pier House for a couple of days in July 2009. I had read the reviews and chose to stay here because it seemed to be the only resort that was walking distance to Duvall and had a useable beach area. Great decision, this place is absolutely wonderfull. The staff are wonderful, helpful and very courteous. The beach is very nice although very small. I realize now that there are really not any nice or well taken care of beaches in Key West. I was satisfied with the beach at Pier House, more so after walking around the neighboring resorts and their "beaches". The resort is quiet and upscale, but once you go out the entry you are immediately on Duvall and everything there is within easy walking distance. Regarding all the bad reviews about the wireless internet access, we stayed in room 271 and had absolutely not problem with the internet. I was able to connect each and every time. I would recommend this resort to my closest friend, I have absolutely no complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous views and great location”
Reviews.Author: bobkatt
Reviews.Content: Pier House was definitely a hit with me. I often travel solo to Key West and loved the location for easy access to my favorite downtown haunts. I also loved that it's a couple blocks from the hub-bub and quiet when you need it. The beach area was gorgeous and swimming in the gulf was fantastic! My lanai room was nicely appointed and very close to the pool /beach. Food and drink are slightly high, but no moreso than other nice properties in the area. The negatives were: in spite of what they say, there is NO internet service in the rooms. The beach bar had access but once you went back to the room, it was gone. I asked many of the guests and we all experienced the same thing. The topless beach area is a nice amenity but it's surrounded by bushes (I'm guessing they were required to do this) which totally ruins the gulf view. The only other problem I had was my refirgerator was turned all the way down and there was no obvious way to adjust it. I called maintenance and they pulled the unti from the cabinet and turned it up - the control was in the back. Not a huge issue, just an annoyance. Overall, I would rate my stay there excellent and in fact, I'll be back in October!

Reviews.Title: “The Pier House Resort was the perfect get-away!”
Reviews.Author: gr8trn
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay at the Pier House Resort! Our room was overlooking the beautiful gardens and pool. The room was very clean and the decor was so Key West! The bathroom was big and gorgeous...now, how many times can you say that about a hotel? The service was wonderful. The chef even cooked our catch from our fishing adventure that Todd, the concierge, recommended. We will definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Peaceful & elegant oasis in Key West”
Reviews.Author: alandg
Reviews.Content: A friend recommended this hotel when our favorite condos didn't have openings. Wow! As soon as you enter the property, all is calm and elegant. Free parking close to all rooms. Convenient location right on Duvall St. but so quiet, you never hear all the commotion. I recommend you spend the extra for a view on the water. It was great watching the beautiful sunsets daily w/o leaving the comfort of our room. Room was beautiful and large. Great bathroom shower and other amenities. Private beach and staff were great. Dinner overlooking the water was peaceful and delicious. A real winner!

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location, decent stay”
Reviews.Author: rileigh15
Reviews.Content: Can you get any closer to Mallory Square? Can you get any closer to the beach? No... Pier House has great location for sure. The staff was super friendly and helpful. Our room was decorated in the region's style. Fun street signs marked the pathways between the different buildings and destinations. The drinks were a little expensive, but it's a resort and expected. Hard floors were perfect for getting sand in the room and lush plants were perfect in creating the island feel. Definitely a safe place to stay, too.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay. Will stay again for right price...”
Reviews.Author: TravelChic214
Reviews.Content: My first choice was Ocean Key but decided to call Pier House and give them a try if they were less expensive. I looked online and saw rates of $199 and $224 for our two weekend nights. Since this was MUCH less than Ocean Key I decided to investigate. I called the hotel with lots of questions and ended up booking a traditional king. I requested a balcony room on the 2nd floor. I was told that they were running a special and the rates were not normal rates (which I knew). When we arrived we were told we were upgraded to a 2nd floor balcony with a courtyard view (as opposed to a parking lot or wall view). Room: The room was great. Perfect for two. Clean, modern, island theme (nice green colors with tropical art) and the balcony was very, very private. It was so lushly landscaped that no one could see in and we could really not see much but the gardens/plants. The bathroom had a large enough walk in rain shower. A/C was touch screen and easy to operate. Housekeeping: Great. The entire hotel and grounds were immaculate. Staff: Non remarkable. Not great, but not bad either. Efficient. Pool/Beach area: Did not go to pool - but it looked clean and simple. Nothing fabulous. However, the small beach area was very nice. The sand was nice, chairs and towels at your service with a smile, the water is deep (not good for kids) and good for snorkeling near the rocks - we saw many tropical fish and crabs. The waves are quite big as the large boats go by. Again, NOT good for kids. We did not see any kids at hotel or on beach. We enjoyed the beach area alot. The hotel is very lushly landscaped with beautiful tropical flowers and a koi pond. Location: Superb. This is the best location in Key West. You don't want to stay at the other end of Duval. Pier House is in the best location - true walking distance to most. Dining: Good food and drinks but pricey. Worst part was our waiter. He was just not with it and seemed miserable. We also waited too long for our food. We didn't get a side item was asked for but when bill came we were charged for it. Waiter did not apologize just corrected the bill. The two major cons of our experience was the fact that sunlight blasted into our room at 6:30 Am from 'grates' in the ceiling above our bed. We couldn't do anything but put blankets over our heads to avoid the sunlight. AND, the balcony was unusable due to the fact that the AC blew hot air out and made the balcony well over 100 degrees. We could really only manage a few minutes on the balcony at a time due to the heat. Overall, we had a good experience at Pier House and would stay again for the same price. I would not pay over $300 to stay in the same room type. TIPS: Request balcony when booking traditional king room. Don't bring your kids here. Make sure your room has no chance of letting morning sun in!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous locations but Pier House is only OKAY!”
Reviews.Author: Sunryz710
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Pier House from May 23rd to May 27th. Pier house is in a fabulous location right on the water and Duvall street and overall clean. It is the small things that make a difference in a property where you just are WOWED and want to go back. The Pier House unfortunately is not very service oriented. Also, did not have amenities that it promised on its website. If you are not well traveled then stay here, you will find it a fine place to stay but go elsewhere if you are used to fine properties. Here are the things that we were disappointed with: 1. Upon check in, there was no orientation of the hotel. It was our first visit and there are 5 buildings. The front desk worker just handed me the key and said you are in room 288. I had to ask her what building it was located in and how to get there. She was puzzled and searched for a property map and first gave me wrong information. She then corrected herself and explained my room was upstairs in the main building. There was no explanation of where the pool was or where the restaurants/bars are located or anything, not even directions to the elevator. This is not the end of the world, but good hotels, give you an orientation when you are checking in. We eventually found the elevator which was un-airconditioned and smelly. We were both worried the room would be the sameâ€¦ but once we found our way to the room our worries subsided. The room was nicely appointed and very clean. The only bad point to the room was the height of the sink in the bathroom. I am 5 ft tall and found it difficult to comfortably use the sink. It was really high.. I wonder how children brush their teeth and wash their hands in the sinks at this property. To give you a visual, I had to be on my tip toes and my chest was even with the surface and try to trajectory spit the toothpaste into the center of the sinkâ€¦ lol.. It was all good. Okay so Pier House advertises on their website that they offer wireless internet access as an amenity in their rooms. This was one of the reasons we booked the property. Unfortunately room 288 doesnâ€™t have internet access. Within 30 minutes of checking in, I called downstairs to see why I wasnâ€™t able to connect. I was told that I would have to go to the beach bar or beach to get access. This was a BIG deal to us because , I had to do some work while in town and it was very inconvenient. They didnâ€™t offer to switch rooms or anything. I didnâ€™t think this was acceptable since it was advertised on their website that there is wireless internet access as an amenity in the rooms. They should list it as some rooms have wireless internet connection not as a general statement referring to all of their rooms. 3rd gripe with the Pier House is that we set a wake up call for Monday morning. The front desk told me I was all set, but we never got the wake up call. Again, not acceptable for a quality hotel. Last but not least the safe in teh room was broken and not working. I know these are little things, but when you add them up, the little things are important. Overall we had a great time in Key West. I do not think we would ever chance the Pier House again especially since there is a Westin, Hyatt and Ocean Key all in equivalent locations. This property may be okay for you.. but we like more upscale properties with excellent service. By the way, I did express our disappointment when we checked out at the front desk. I also sent an email to management when I returned home but did not receive a response.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful!”
Reviews.Author: Steeler_Fanatic
Reviews.Content: The Pier House is simply heaven on earth! Spend the extra money and stay in a Gulf Front room! We go back year after year and I cannot wait until next year. What a marvelous place!

Reviews.Title: “Had a great time, great location, attentive staff”
Reviews.Author: Beachcouple3
Reviews.Content: First the good, great location, lovely room, beautiful beach and a very friendly staff. In particular beach attendants Gregory and Alex were great! Now the not so good, we stayed in the Spa building. If you want to sleep late (past 6:15 am) don't stay there, or at least in the rooms facing the parking lot. The gardeners start very early (6 am), and roll out their carts (a trash can on wheels). You can't believe how much noise those things make, I guess they figure they're up so everybody should be up. This didn't happen one morning, it happened every morning! Also, be aware if you enjoy the topless beach check to make sure there are no weddings during your stay. This beach is cleared of guests well in advance of weddings. While we were there they had a wedding scheduled 7:30, they started setting up at noon. We were not asked to leave at noon but staff was all around us setting up. Luckily just one day was affected.

Reviews.Title: “Great vacation!”
Reviews.Author: kathyjeanne
Reviews.Content: Key West is always fun and staying at the Pier House only made it better. Rooms, service and location was first rate. Awesome massage...thanks Bob! Only improvement would have been an "adult only" or maybe a kiddie pool. I've never been a fan of sharing adult swimming pools with babies in diapers! Otherwise you couldn't ask for a better place.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise in the perfect location”
Reviews.Author: kittiv
Reviews.Content: My husband and I made our second visit to the Pier House April 9-14. This was our first time back since the renovation and we didnâ€™t think it could get any better but we were wrong. The renovations were gorgeous! We were on the second floor of the main building, the room had the most comfortable king sized bed ever. The bathroom was so beautiful and had a rain shower which was amazingâ€¦.who new you could be so relaxed by water â€œrainingâ€� on you, it was the BEST! The hotel has WiFi and we used it when we could the connection was very poor (at least from our room). The grounds were absolutely stunning as usual and the staff was great. Check in and out went smoothly. In fact we arrived around 12:30 and were surprised that the room was ready and we were able to check in. At check out they held our bags until we had to catch our plane. The location is the best in the Key West. You are right on the water (without any cruise ships blocking your view) literally steps from the fun bars of Duval and busyness of Mallory Square but once you step foot onto Pier Houseâ€™s property you forget about the crowds and are immediately relaxed by the scenery. The pool bar and restaurant made great food at reasonable prices (drinks were a little pricey though) and even had poolside or beachside service. The pool was nice, except for the kids (and their parents) that didnâ€™t care where you were relaxing because they were jumping right on top of us without any apologies from them or their parents. Donâ€™t get me wrong kids are great, we have a 7 year old but he would NEVER disrespect the space and â€œrelaxationâ€� of the people around him and if he did I would apologize and reprimand him; these parents never said a word. Besides that ;which was no fault of the Pier House our trip was incredible and will be back in the future!!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful tropical hotel with best location.”
Reviews.Author: maryb322
Reviews.Content: Just came back with friends celebrating our birthdays. There was confusion about rooms but it was taken care of quickly with great customer service. One room was a suite; the other two were one room. One room was small; the other bedroom was roomy. The suite had plenty of room with wonderful view. We had excellent service at the pool/beach bar. The servers couldn't have been nicer. Pool/beach - clean, quiet and relaxing. Location, location, location...The only place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Place to Stay in Key West!”
Reviews.Author: Chris3051
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a Garden Room (ground level) so that we could walk in and out of our room to the pool,beach, bar. It was great! We stayed in other nice hotels at Key West and now for the last four years we go to the Pier House! No complaints here! This is a great place for adults.....not for kids.

Reviews.Title: “a perfect getaway that we cant wait to return to for many years”
Reviews.Author: vakagetaway
Reviews.Content: We had an amazing time at the pier house. We decided 1 month before in advance that we needed a vacation from New England, we were able to book a room for 1 week and it was well worth it. The location is perfect for anything we wanted to do, the staff was very friendly and we cant wait to return. HOWEVER we lost our credit card's the 1st night we were there and when we realized the next morning and went to the front desk for HELP we were met with total non-professional service, the clerk was more involved in her conversation about her personal life with a uninterested fellow employee than helping us. We were very distraught and it just fell on deaf ear"s. We asked a maintenance worker and were surprised at how quick he responded to our needs and within 1 hour the problem was solved and we were directed to a locale business that was more than helpful in dealing with our problem, when we first could have handled this from the start but due to the front desk employee's superfical attitude we sat in our room trying to figure out the best way to handle this problem 2000 miles from home. We did have to wait 4 days for new cards to arrive but the resort staff was very helpful and made the best of things for us, The employees were extremely helpful from the house keeping staff to the bar tenders and waiters from the beach side bar were were just so helpful and fun to be around, they really enjoy their job and honestly want to make everyone's stay their fun and relaxing . We with out a doubt will be returning to the pier house with our teenage children and other family members next april...The pier house is truly paradise and we cant wait to return.........missing key west from cape cod

Reviews.Title: “Great location, updated room, helpful staff.”
Reviews.Author: landloper
Reviews.Content: The Pier House is located at the foot of famous Duval Street in the Old Town section of Key West, a block form Mallory Square and the Harbor Walk. We stayed at a Caribbean Spa room. It was spacious and newly renovated with flat-screen TV (one in the bathroom too), refrigerator, king size bed, wi-fi, plank floor and tasteful furnishings. We could hear a rooster crowing each day. Outside the French doors is a stone terrace with table and comfortable chairs, perfect for morning coffee, screened by tropical bushes and trees. Just enough morning sun filters through the vegetation. The babble of spilling water from the hot tub at the spa drowns out the minimal street noise. As with most things new and untried, there are some features that could be improved. The closet needs a light. The shower is modern and well-designed, but splashed water collects on the door sill and spills out under the half-inch gap below the shower door. Exit the shower and you step into a substantial puddle on the bathroom floor. (I notified the desk when I checked out. Meanwhile, I placed a towel on the floor before showering to soak up the spill.) The lighting at the bathroom mirror could be brighter. The bathroom sink pop-up came apart in my hand the first time I used it, so the water wouldnâ€™t drain out of the sink. Iâ€™m mechanical, so I re-assembled it myself and had no further trouble. The TV should have been mounted on a pivot so it could be more easily rotated to face the chairs or the bed. (In its place on a narrow shelf, it faces a blank wall). One set of French doors was a security risk due to defective installation. I found no microwave in the room, and there are no vending machines on the premises I was told, by design I suspect. The Harbor View CafÃ©, one of four restaurants/bars at Pier House, has excellent blueberry muffins for breakfast and an outstanding key lime pie with meringue topping at lunchtime. Al fresco dining is an option but it was too windy for us when we were there. I observed several guests enjoying the private beach. The staff at the hotel and the restaurant was competent, polite and knowledgeable.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best in Key West”
Reviews.Author: kate413
Reviews.Content: This was our third visit at this resort. It has been renovated and the rooms are amazing. We had a garden view with balcony. The beds are very big and comfy. The bathroom was spacious with a walk in shower. Most of all the rooms were very clean! The beach and pool area are well maintained and the service at the outdoor restaurant/bar was excellent. We had a fun time in the piano bar at night - the bartender and the performers were alot of fun and we ended up having drinks with them all one night after the show! The location can not be beat - it is on Duval and right by Mallory Square and the harbor. We did not use our car once during our stay - we walked everywhere. We will definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Totally different and laid-back.”
Reviews.Author: WaterHoser
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a harbor-view room with sailboats outside the patio. It was kind of other-worldly when I was awakened in the middle of the night by a dog on one sailboat barking at a cat on another sailboat. I've told that story quite a few times since. We also thought it was interesting that so many of the descendants of Hemingway's six-toed cats can be found around the property as we strolled around it. The location was also close to Mallory Square and much of the nightlife.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT Location....noisey accomodations!”
Reviews.Author: LMBTraveler
Reviews.Content: GREAT location for one who desires to be proximal to the dining and eclectic shops of Duval Street. We stayed in the Spa House, which had fairly spacious rooms, but the view was not appealing, i.e. there was NO VIEW: tree tops, concrete and asphalt. In addition, the noise (music?) from the club next door went on until midnight..very disturbing. Even more annoying was the crowing rooster who awoke us at 4:30 every morning! Ordered room service once...at 10 p.m. upon arrival. it was cold and unappealing..and over-priced. Best bet is the local restaurants.....fresh food, better value. Enjoyed the entertainment on the beach, albiet the private beach a bit small and cramped. Nice gardens..but the other buildings are in need of paint: rust throughout the facility on the wrought iron staircases and bannisters. This is not what one expects from an advertised upscale resort. The staff was friendly, but not very experienced in exceeding customer expectation. They did not offer resort orientation nor suggestions of how to navigate the grounds. Hotel operator was polite, friendly, and helpful. Free parking was nice :o)

Reviews.Title: “GOOD location, good rooms, good food”
Reviews.Author: Ferdis10
Reviews.Content: For our first trip to Key West Pier HR is a great location at the end of Duval St. close to everything yet quiet and peaceful. Ample on property parking. Our room (Caribbean Spa) was recently upgraded and well very appointed. Our dinner in the Piano Bar was great with a good wine selection and the piano was entertaining. We weren't troubled by anyone and we didn't try any of the other facilities. We ate out one night at the Blue Heaven which was over-rated, they had lost my reservation but kept us waiting only 15 mins. Word of warning, return straight to Duval St after and do not stray far in any other direction since (local advice) it is next to an unsafe drug area. Key West is littered with modern retail Americana smothering the charm of this quaint old town and its architecture. Worth a visit though.

Reviews.Title: “Pier House exceeded our expectations”
Reviews.Author: IndySooner
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from a first-time trip to Key West where we stayed at the Pier House (chosen based on reviews in Trip Advisor). The hotel staff was very friendly and eager to assist (I have to say I don't know how the negative comments about unfriendly employees originate - I can only surmise that competitors have a hand in it). We had booked a standard room through Orbitz and so we were expecting the lower level with a less than desirable view. I asked the desk clerk if she could 'hook us up' with the best room for our rate and we were blown away by the accomodations and view of the gulf. The Pier House, just as others have described, is in a perfect location - a one-minute walk to Duval Street yet distant enough to avoid the late-night rowdiness. We did not eat in the hotel restaurants but for no other reason than we had picked out a few other spots based on advice from other travelers. The pool and beach area were very nice - yes the beach was small but for the capacity of the hotel it was more than adequate. Dining-out notes: lunch at Caroline's Cafe was very good (and the people-watching factor was excellent), lunch at Southermost Cafe was okay, best lunch of all was at Kelly's. Dinner at Sarabeth's was very good (Sunday night fried chicken), dinner at Duffy's was good (we intended to eat at Seven Fish but did not realize you needed a reservation - ALWAYS call ahead for reservations at the nicer restaurants), and we splurged and enjoyed our final night's dinner at Lattitude's on Sunset Key (pricey, but well worth it because of the trip over to the island and the beautiful setting). Also, Guy Harvey's bar has the greatest happy hour prices but it is pretty quiet compared to Sloppy Joe's and the other Duval Street mainstays.

Reviews.Title: “Great Spot!”
Reviews.Author: magsmom
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay. Stay'd in one of the loft rooms. Had no complaints, except the shower door leaks all over the floor everytime you shower. Minor complaint because we loved our unit. It was brand new and even had a tv in the bath. I am sure they are working on this and I would not let this inhibit your stay here. The best location in Key West.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding!”
Reviews.Author: wintertraveler05
Reviews.Content: Everything about Pier House was perfect. Even when we called to make the reservation. We stayed in the Spa building. Our room was huge and very well appointed. There were two double doors out onto a balcony. The bed was super comfortable and we enjoyed a great nights sleep. It was very clean and quiet. There was even a TV in our bathroom! Unlike other "upscale" hotels in the area that would charge for parking, Pier House has plenty of FREE parking. A perfect location for walking everywhere. It doesn't get much better and this is the place for us when we return to Key West.

Reviews.Title: “Worth every dime”
Reviews.Author: dalcy3
Reviews.Content: Not only is this hotel in a great location (next to Sunset Pier) but it's also well maintained, super comfortable, has a private beach and pool - great spa and friendly staff. I thought it was pricey but once I got there I realized it was worth the money. I'm not sure I could stay anywhere else in Key West now that I've been so spoiled. I had a hard time finding photos of the hotel as the website isn't great - so I'm uploading a few here

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: kashmirohio
Reviews.Content: The rooms were lovely and the grounds are well kept, peaceful and private. However, the food is priced well over what it should be and the dock at the beach was splattered with bird dung. Overall, very nice. (The front desk people are a bit stand offish...not sure why)

Reviews.Title: “Pier House ROCKED”
Reviews.Author: BeachedOkie
Reviews.Content: My wife and I celebrated our 6 year anniversary with a 4 night stay at the Pier House. We absolutely loved it, we stayed in a second floor garden view room that was recently renovated. The water front rooms were under construction. We stayed the weekend between two hurricanes/tropical storms, I spoke with Pier House front desk at least 5 times, about cancellation/rescheduling polices , they were always pleasant and very helpful. The rooms were very clean and very nice only downfall our room was directly above the Chart Room Bar, we were woke up a couple of times around 6 to the workers cleaning up from the night before. It was OK we just finished sleeping it off on the private beach, we never left the beach until sunset. Capn' Dan at the beach bar was great, full of knowledge and made great drinks. We at breakfast and lunch there once, food was very good. Pool and grounds were always very clean and pool and spa stayed open 24 hours, very nice for the late night swim after doing the Duval Crawl. Another plus was location, you couldn't get any closer to the action of Duval St. Overall the Pier House met and exceded all our expectations, we meet many friendly and fun people while there. We are already looking for the next long weekend we can stay at the Pier House

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Good Stay”
Reviews.Author: SuaveShell
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Pier House for two days (Wed/Thurs) for a getaway from the freezing temperatures of the north. Was in Key West for 4 days but decided to stay here the first two as with many hotels, their prices went up on the weekend while the other hotel we chose to stay at on the Island (Casa Marina Resort - see another review) their weekend prices were much lower then weekday rates. When you first arrive, it almost seems like a motel like many of the western hotels. The parking is FREE which is a huge plus. The location is absolutely perfect for all the night life as it is literally at the very top of Duval Street, next to Mallory Square. The hotel has a very small beach (think the size of a postage stamp) that would be great for kids and kids alone. The pool look nice but we didn't utilize it. As other reviewers have said, when you first get there, it can be tricky to find your room as it is kind of a maze but once you get used to the layout, everything is very quick and easy. Take some time to actually walk around this resort as it is bigger then it looks and pretty to look at. The piers go out into the Gulf with a view of Sunset Key Island. If you tell the front desk you have a special occasion a head of time, they might just give you a free bottle of champagne (they did that to us). However, unless you have an ocean view (which I high recommend), your view will not be that great and you will feel like you are paying too much. I can't comment on the spa but it appeared that it probably would be pretty nice. Other then our view, the only other complaints that we really had was on the morning before we were set to leave, the first alarm started to malfunction and this went on for hours waking us up several times. No apologies given. Also, I understand that they "technically" have a beach, but they really shouldn't be advertising this due to its size and the view you get from it. The lobby could be nicer but who really stays in the lobby anyways. Be prepared, no elevators in the main building. Also, room service was very limited if any at all and the beach side bar never was open in the evening that we could see. The other bar was but only had a couple people in there so if you like to mingle, this isn't the best place to do it. Other then that, the hotel room was nice. Old but very modern at the same time and a decent size (not cramped). We had a balcony but it overlooked the hotel next door/parking lot and had a palm tree covering most of it (had to wade thru the leaves). The bathroom was very modern and nice. The staff seemed nice as well. If you want to be in a great location for the strip then this is the best value you may find, especially with a true ocean view and a spa lover.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Wedding in Paradise”
Reviews.Author: Des_623
Reviews.Content: We go to Key West at least once a year for vacation and always stay at the Pier House. We loved it so much, when we decided to get married, we thought it would be the perfect place to have a wedding. Just like Key West, it was so carefree to plan our wedding and work with the wedding coordinator. Everything exceeded our expectations. The ceremony, food, music, photography, flowers, everything was perfect. We had 30 friends and family members attend, and everyone said it was the most beautiful and funnest wedding they had ever been to. We are planning an anniversary trip for next year and could not imagine staying anywhere other than the Pier House! We like the Carribean Spa rooms the best. It is so comfortable and spacious with traditional Key West style. Not to mention the spa is in the same building and is a getaway in itself. All of the staff, whether it be at the spa, pool, bar, or front desk are exceptional. They make you feel very welcome and are very accomodating. There is no other hotel near all the Duval St. action that has such an incredible pool and private beach area. My favorite thing is laying out on the beach while listening to the steel drums of Bongo D at the beach bar sipping on a pina coloda. Paradise found!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: AJT36
Reviews.Content: I spent 4 nights at Pier House and overall I was very happy with my stay. The resort is located at the end of Duval Street so it is right in the middle of Key West night life. I drove to Key West. There was plenty of parking at the resort and 24 hour security at the front gate. The staff was pleasant and helpful in providing me information about attractions. I ate breakfast once at the resort's restaurant and it was good... typical resort breakfast, typical prices. My room was clean and nicely decorated. It appeared recently renovated, and included a flat screen TV (cable TV w/HBO), very nice shower, big bed, refrigerator. A/C worked great and kept the room cool. There is an in-room safe which can accommodate a full size laptop, camera and other items easily. I couldn't get the internet to work, though I suspect staff would have helped me if I had asked. I used my AT&T wireless card instead. My room was a "garden" view room though it really looked out over the front courtyard (you could see some "garden" but it was mostly courtyard). Noise from the outside was not a problem, even though the opposing hotel's nightspot on the pier was close enough that I could hear the party from my deck. With the sliding door closed, I couldn't hear a thing. Noise between room walls was also not a problem. The noise from the room's door was a bit of a problem. The renovations to Pier House did not include sound proofing in the hallways and for whatever reason, sound really made it through the door to my room. I was only really bothered by this on Saturday night when several guest came back late and were a little loud, and on Sunday morning, when a guest dragged his or her rolling suitcase down the stairs at 6 AM. I think some sound proofing around the room doors would fix this and perhaps some sound proofing on the hallway floor and walls. That was really my only complaint with the whole stay. The hallways were a little "mazey" and it took me two days to figure out how to get from my room out the front of the resort without getting lost. Also, there wasn't an elevator that I could see, though staff has to be able to get cleaning carts up to the second/third floors, so there must be something. There are several very attractive "rain forest" walkways through the resort. The resort's private beach is small, but nice, with a pontoon to lay out on. From what I observed, boat wake may be a problem. I watched a boat race by the morning I had breakfast and it really generated some waves. Overall I enjoyed my stay. If you like being in the middle of everything, this is a great place to stay. There is a CVS open until midnight across the street. The majority of Key West night life is 1-5 blocks away as well as Mallory Square. If you are not interested in being in the "thick of things", you are better off staying a few blocks off of Duval Street or at the south end of Duval Street.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: grouptraveler8
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with 3 other couples for three nights, our first time in Key West. The hotel was beautifully decorated, & great bathrooms. A nice, small beach & pool, & an outstanding location. Right off Mallory Square, & most of the popular bars & restaurants. We all agreed we'd stay here again if we ever return to Key West.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointment”
Reviews.Author: raleighRdu
Reviews.Content: We recently returned from our son's wedding which was held on the beach in Key West. Their wedding reception was held directly after the ceremony at the Pier House. We had a total of 7 rooms reserved with a minimum of 4 days required for each room. The groundskeepers, housekeeping staff and valets were great. The remainder of the staff were cold and rude to many of our guests. The wedding reception did not live up to the contract and this proved a disappointment to the Bride and Groom. My greatest complaint is that I have contacted the Manager at the Resort via email and to date there has been no response; and, even worse, the Bride has not been able to reach anyone or have anyone return phone calls since the wedding. There has been many discrepanices in billing and service, and it seems that Pier House does not wish to respond even as a courtesy. This would lead me to believe that customer service is not something they want to provide.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful resort!”
Reviews.Author: mau18
Reviews.Content: For our semi-annual get-away my three friends and I chose Key West to visit. We live in southwest Florida so we were able to take a ferry from Fort Myers, Florida right to Key West. Since we wouldn't have a car we chose the Pier House for it's perfect location in the old town of Key West where most of the tourist attractions and restaurants are located. We could not have chosen better! When we arrived we were told that we had been upgraded to two junior suites. Much to our delight we had two beautiful rooms with large balconies facing the ocean. (room 201 and 301) The rooms were newly furnished in a Caribean style with comfortable beds and excellent bedding. The balcony was furnished with a lounge and two chairs with comfy cushions. We had lunch in their beach front restaurant which served very nice food. We could not have enjoyed our stay more. We could walk to all the places we wanted to visit but there were reasonably priced taxis available when we wanted to go a little further away. We always celebrate whoever's birthday is closest to our trip so we chose "Louie's Back Yard" for our dinner. It was served on a deck facing the ocean on a beautiful Florida evening with a wonderful menu and charming and efficient waitstaff. There are many places to visit but we enjoyed the Truman White House very much as well as the Butterly Museum. All in all Key West and the Pier House were an absolute success!!

Reviews.Title: “Customer service is truely DEAD”
Reviews.Author: lhsteeda
Reviews.Content: We recently held our wedding reception at the Pier House. We had friends and family stay here also. We never met the "special events" planner face to face. She relies completely on email and voicemail. She left a voicemail on our hotel phone to say that she would not be attending the reception, so she would be sending a replacement. The promised decorations for the reception were missing. The replacement planner approached our guests to ask them to leave, and actually told one guest that he would charge her by the minute. I would have appreciated him confronting me since I was not hard to find (the white dress)... The next morning I pulled the Customer Service Manager into her office, and explained the entire situation. I still to this day have not had any contact from them except the paid invoice. On top of all of this they over charged us with some bogus disclaimer on page 8 of the contract........ Very dissatisfied... Recommend Ocean Key next door!!!!! Should not be rated as a four star resort.....

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: swan056
Reviews.Content: What a beautiful hotel, perfectly situated on Duval Street, our room was brilliant for a family of 4, 2 x doubles, 1 x double sofa bed, 2 bathrooms , great facilities. Stiuated next to the pool which was very clean and well kept. Iced water available at the side of the pool. Stunning view of the private beach especially at sunset. Private beach very clean lots of small fish to see. Ate in the restaurant where the food was excellant. Service great, would go again without any hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Super Hotel”
Reviews.Author: coconutcharlie
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful time. We stayed three nights in a Garden Room - very nice! Great location. Great spa services. We highly recommend Pier House! Joanie and Mike at the bar could not have been more attentive. We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely & Beautiful - a Favorite”
Reviews.Author: ccjersey
Reviews.Content: We stayed 5 nights at the end of August. Our room was upgraded from a Garden View room to a 2 Room Suite. The room was beautiful - the new renovations are fabulous. We had a lovely welcome, staff was very nice, grounds always tropical & gorgeous. Our room had 2 balconies, 2 tv's, 2 bathrooms, living room & bedroom. The high ceililngs let in a lot of sunshine & linens were luxurious. I would highly recommend. For Key West, this is a great resort. The best location & you get a small beach which is rare for this part of Old Town. We love the Pier House. The Chart Room Bar is a secret hidden gem -- another reason we like the Pier House. A real unique spot. This hotel is totally Key West, charming & unique.

Reviews.Title: “WONDERFUL RESORT”
Reviews.Author: DennyNewJersey
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the pier house for 4 nights. We stayed in a waterfront room which was beautiful and kept very clean. The staff at the hotel were very friendly. The private beach was perfect and really a pleasure to have because key west does not have alot of beaches. THe pier house is in a perfect location we parked our car when we arrived and did not use it again until we left, you are so close to duval street, mallory square and just about anything else you would like to do in key west. I cannot wait to return to key west and the pier house.

Reviews.Title: “Pier House "Great"”
Reviews.Author: hopsingh
Reviews.Content: The Pier House was all it said it would be and more.Although pricie the place was just wonderful.All of the people who worked there were just so nice and helpful and the guy at the towel both was really cool, always remembered our room number.Great view of the sunsets and clean beach area.

Reviews.Title: “tropical oasis!”
Reviews.Author: MarylandZinnia
Reviews.Content: I haven't left home for a vacation in 7 years and wanted to go somewhere pretty and beachy to read, relax, swim, eat, sleep and shop. I also wanted a place with enough action to appeal to a 21 year old son and 18 year old daughter. After surfing the net for 3 weeks and reading the reviews, I chose Key West and Pier House. WOW! We stayed for a week and loved every minute! The location is for you if you want a glorious view of the Gulf and Sunset Key, sandy beach with a large private swimming area, pool, beachside bar and restaurant, secluded feel, family friendly, attentive staff, comfortable clean rooms and prompt, friendly room service. As if all this isn't enough, the use of the fitness room and hot tub at the Spa is free! We also splurged and had a massage which you must do when you go. It is worth every penny you have saved for this vacation. If you don't want to eat all of your meals at the resort (which are delicious, by the way), just walk out of the resort onto Duval St, and the restaurants, bars, shops, access to water sports, and museums are right there! Yes, the garden view rooms are undergoing renovation, but it didn't bother us. We had a Harbor View room and it was quiet. So, don't let that stop you. I would like to go back to Key West and stay there again. Maybe next time it will be a girl's getaway:)

Reviews.Title: “Late review on an ok hotel”
Reviews.Author: Joesluckygal
Reviews.Content: This is really late, as our visit was March 9,2008. We traveled from Key Largo to Key West with our two 7 year olds to stay in a double bed room. The room was ok for just staying overnight. The room's decor was outdated. The crown moulding bothered me, but that's just me being picky. We had stayed at another resort which is much lower in the ratings, but we thought it was much better than the Pier. Stayed across the street before at another location and LOVED that place. This suited our purpose for being in the middle of the action, but I was definitely not impressed enough to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location!”
Reviews.Author: starglitter
Reviews.Content: This hotel has the perfect location - right at the beginning of Duval Street and right on the water. They have a small sandy beach (even an area for topless sunbathing) and great pool area. We had a ground floor room with a small patio outside. We were within steps of the pool and the restaurants. One evening we even discovered the piano bar with a personable entertainer. You are within walking distance to Mallory Square, restaurants, and all the bars on Duval Street. The hotel room was very nice. The decorations in our room had a tropical airy feel. We had rented a car and drove from MIA but never used our car the whole week. Hotel staff was friendly and always spoke to us when we were sitting outside on the patio, the atmosphere was relaxing! Only downpoint was there seemed to be lots of construction (renovations?) on the rooms close to the water, but we were not affected at all by this. Definitely going back next April!

Reviews.Title: “Great Memories”
Reviews.Author: GoodLivin
Reviews.Content: After a long beautiful drive from Miami, what a great place to settle down for a week...We loved our choice. The Pier House is in a perfect location. Once we got checked into our room, the only bad thing I can say is we didn't get a king bed like we requested. The front desk tried to accomodate us but we were fine with our 2 double beds. We were just happy to be away and in the sun and feel the Key West vibe. The rooms were clean and very comfortable. The private beach is fabulous, nice sand and a great place to hang out and relax. The pool is clean and open 24 hours. Make sure to take a mid night swim! We loved to finish off our nights at the hotels little bar "The Chart Room" we met great people. Make sure to meet Captain Dan. He took great care of us all week. Made fresh popcorn and made excellent drinks. We learned alot about the locals at this little bar....This vacation was filled with great memories and this hotel is where we would definately come back and stay. You cant get a better location. We didn't have a car the whole week and we didn't need one. Get ready to walk, or rent a bike which is a great experience. Loved It!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous Pier House - Loved It!!!!!! Great Pool Scene!”
Reviews.Author: MadelineNewYorkCity
Reviews.Content: This is a fantastic resort hotel with a great pool and beautiful and clean private beach (the beach is small but very lovely, and even has a topless area). The rooms are very nice, simple and classy, we just had the most basic room on the first floor but it had a nice patio. If you can afford the pricier rooms, go for it! Pier house offers a variety of rooms, some suites with balconies and water views, also the garden views are lovely I'm sure. The location of the hotel can't be beat, at the beginning of Duval St. near all sorts of shopping, attractions, great restaraunts and nightlife, but tucked away and lavished with gorgeous tropical plants and trees everywhere, very dreamy! We didn't eat too much at the hotel, however they have a variety of restaraunts, the room service was excellent...The best part for us was the pool and private beach...the pool has a nice bar and is enclosed within a tropical garden with gorgeous and abundant trees and a view of the gulf of mexico divine!!! We came to Key West to escape NYC for a long weekend and can't wait to return, we'll definately stay at the Pier House again

Reviews.Title: “The ideal location in Key West”
Reviews.Author: Thepaw60
Reviews.Content: I simply could not imagine a better location in Key West. Located at the bottom of Duval Street, you are within sight of the bars, restaurants shopping and night life of Duval Street, Mallory Square, with the nightly sunset show and crowd is a two minute walk along the water, and the marinas, with their charter boats, activities and restaurants is at the end of the block. We stayed in a standard room, the cheapest they had. We could have stayed in a Garden or Harbor view for considerably more, but they are the exact same room ( we had them show us), but with the view indicated. Since we do not spend a lot of time in the room, we could not see a reason to spend all that money. The bar is very pleasant, and pours a good drink. There is a small private beach, nice pool, grounds are well kept. We did not eat here on the advice of some locals we ran into at the bar, who said they were happy to drink here, but would never eat here. We made Pepe's on Caroline our breakfast spot, with great omlettes and wonderful atmosphere. Bed could be newer, matteress is a bit lumpy, but the room is just fine overall. Not high luxury, but easily serves its purpose.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointingly inconsistent”
Reviews.Author: Flamingotropicale
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have been staying at the Pier House once or twice per year for 7 years. We always get the same room, a two bedroom suite which rents for $1300-$1600 a night. Obviously, we like this hotel: the location, the garden and beach, the peacefulness, and the view from the balcony. Unfortunately, we like this place almost in spite of itself. The quality has been inconsistent over the years, but we adjust to the laid-back Key West style. Our latest visit, however, was very disappointing. When we booked our trip 3 months' ago, we were told that new construction next to our suite would be finished except for minor interior trim work. When we arrived, we found an active construction site surrounding our room. The circular saw station next to our balcony was non-stop noisy, sawdust covered all the balcony furniture and blew around in the breeze. Deconstruction and nailing were incessant. Sometimes the workmen had to inch along our balcony rail to avoid falling off the torn up deck. The workmen were very nice and apologetic for the mess; I don't blame them for doing what they had to do. Hotel management was less concerned, however. If construction was in such a state, couldn't they have called and told us before we arrived? We are going again in 6 weeks for a vacation with our grown daughters.
