Questioning two managers, the front desk personnel, and guest relations manager about the construction status in 6 weeks only got a "call us before you come" response. Okay. One more time. The next time might be the last. If you are going soon, and Pier House does have a lot to recommend it, I'd suggest you be very specific in questioning the status of construction when you make your reservation.

Reviews.Title: “Realistic Expectations”
Reviews.Author: nyny625
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights in mid March 2008. The hotel is in a perfect location. The restaurant staff was great, but the front desk staff was not very friendly. We had a pleasant stay, since the room was clean and functional, and we were close to all the main points of interest. However, we definitely have had better rooms for the same price. The hotel definitely needs to be updated. You will have a great time as long as you have reasonable expectations.

Reviews.Title: “check in was very poor”
Reviews.Author: travelPennsylvania
Reviews.Content: While we were checking in, our front desk clerk quit taking care of us to answer the phone and did not get back to us. We did not know where our room was located. So we wondered around looking for it, thinking foolishly that a 400 number would be on the fourth floor. A house keeper finally told us were our room was. Then none of the door keys worked. I had to find my way back to the front desk and ask for room keys that worked and a map. They were quite snooty and rude. Our room was nice enough, no carpets,and newer tile and wood floors. BUT it was the noisiest air conditioner I ever had. It vibrated the room and went on and off multiple times during the night waking us up. We had to put pillows and the lamp against it to stop some of the vibrations. The bed was not very comfortable. The pool area was quiet and nice, the beach was small, and ok except for the construction taking place on the addition.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointed”
Reviews.Author: LBSIllinois
Reviews.Content: I've never written a review before but decided I should in this case because of the disappointing experience we had at The Pier House. For $400 a night, we expected high quality rooms and amenities. Sadly, we were quite wrong. Starting with the cinder block walls in the dark hallways (think old college dorm), followed by a tiny room with a small old bathroom, this stay did not live up to our expectations. We only stayed one night and then moved across the street to the Ocean Key Resort where we had a much nicer room (and amenities, service, pool) for a better price. On a positive note, the concierge was very helpful when we called in advance of our stay to make reservations for some activities.

Reviews.Title: “Frequent Traveler who LOVES the Pier House in Key West!”
Reviews.Author: Wojgirl
Reviews.Content: EXCELLENT Service! HAPPY Staff! BEAUTIFUL Room! Food is WONDERFUL! GREAT Private Beach! BEST Location! My husband and I (both in our early 30s) agree that the Pier House is awesome! I travel often for work and have high standards for the hotels I stay in and the Pier House exceeded my expectations. We had a king/garden suite room which was clean and very comfortable. The property is well maintained, and in the best location (right by everything, but secluded enough so you don't hear all the buzz going on the island when you are trying to sleep). In addition, we had trouble getting out of Cleveland, OH due to the worst blizzard in 30 years closing the airport. We changed our reservations 4 times (we were to leave Sat. and didn't get out of OH until Tues.), and the Pier House staff was awesome with accommodating our ever changing schedule. We'll be back next year (maybe even later this year)!

Reviews.Title: “Holiday of a lifetime”
Reviews.Author: BdeB
Reviews.Content: This is a truely great hotel and the staff are fantastic and so helpful. We had an ocean view room looking straight over the beach. There is an ample sized swimming pool but you just cant beat a swim in the sea by the private beach. The gardens within the resort are beatifully maintained, Food and Drink is all very good value and tasty. I recommend the Lobster Club Sandwich ! The hotel itself is in walking distance of Malory and Duval St. A great location and well worth the journey from Ireland !. ONly complaint is watch the glass in the Patio Doors - its so clean you cant tell if its open or closed and you can easily walk straight into it ! One final thing is we missed our connection flight to Key West for the first night due to delays in Atlanta and the hotel still rebated the cost of our room - Nice one :-)

Reviews.Title: “Go ahead and Book it here.”
Reviews.Author: SLW1
Reviews.Content: We stayed there weekend of feb. 19th, and If you are looking at this hotel. Just book it. You have pool, small beach and bar with servers that handle it all. Rooms are clean and comfortable. All staff members we encountered were very polite. They even brought a mini fridge upon request at no charge. Also, we checked out to go catch our early am flight. Arrived at airport to find out it was canceled, so we returned to hotel and they let us back in the room until our next flight. And yes, the location- #1. We walked everywhere. Duval, marina and etc. I have no clue why they have any negative reviews. The only minor negative detail we had was bathroom size. But we didn't sleep in there, so that was not a big issue. So just call and book it.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: RockyMorse
Reviews.Content: We have been to Key West several times and enjoy staying at different B&B's and hotels in this wonderful town. This time we stayed at the Pier House and highly recommend it. The location is perfect if you want to be directly on the ocean near Mallory Square. We have stayed at the Westin which is close by but decided we preferred the Pier House. The Westin has a wonderful view of the ocean, except that most of the time it is blocked by cruise ships. The Pier House doesn't have this problem. Also we really enjoyed the extensive tropical gardens which abound on the property. This resort also has a lovely sand beach just below the pool area. We found the staff exceptionally pleasant and they seemed to truly enjoy their jobs and were very welcoming. Our room was lovely as you would expect in this price range. It had a balcony overlooking the beautiful gardens and pool area. A real plus is that parking is included with your room and it an easy in and out parking lot (unlike the Westin). We will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay-Expensive”
Reviews.Author: drummer1220
Reviews.Content: My wife and I live in Florida and wanted to have a quick get-a-way. We decided to go to Key West so we read reviews of different places to stay,chose the Pier House,made a reservation for 1/26 jumped in the car and headed south.We booked the Carribean Spa room because we liked the reviews. We arrived early and were greeted by smiling faces . I had requested an early check-in and I was not disappointed.We were allowed to check in by 11 a.m because the room had just been vacated.The front desk, in fact all of the employees that we had contact with were very helpful and friendly. We loved our Spa Room (623) on the second floor and across the street from the Rum Barrell. If you do not like a good band playing outside your window do not stay on this side of the Pier House,get a garden view or a harbor view,that is probably the quiet side. I had the French doors open and listened to the music until I could no longer stay awake. I walked across the smooth bamboo floors,closed the doors and fell into a very comfortable bed with crisp linen's and slept like a baby while the band played on. Some people have written the the jacuzzi tub is difficult to get into,well it is deep and you cannot step into it but if you sit on the edge,lift your leg's and turn yourself into the tub it shouldn't be a problem for anyone who does not have a severe handicap. The jacuzzi tub was just what we needed at the end of the day . The a/c was cool and efficient and a might be a little loud for some people, I know,how can you hear the a/c with the band and street sounds? Well with the French door's closed the street sounds are not that bad. A little more about the room....the bed had plenty of pillows. I always like some extra towels so I asked the housekeeping girls and was given towels without a hitch. The room was very clean and bare feet on that bamboo floor felt great. We had a great time and it was just what we were looking for with walking distance to most places. It was expensive ( 349+a night) and that was discounted I was told. I believe they wanted 379+ a night. We would definitely stay there again,of course it would be nice if it were a little less expensive . Then again if we skipped the lobster dinner at the wonderful A + B Lobster House we could stay there more often : ) We hope this was helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Slice of sunshine & fun wrapped up!”
Reviews.Author: londoner1964
Reviews.Content: Fantastic accommodation, clean & well appointed rooms. Centrally located with lovely pool & beach. Would return in a heartbeat. . . enjoy if you go!

Reviews.Title: “Good, but overpriced”
Reviews.Author: vancebb
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from the Pier House. We spent New Year's in the Keys and it was quite enjoyable. The best part of this hotel is the location! It is at the far end of Duval Street, so you can walk to everything very quickly. It is also at the end of the street where the crowds thin out. We really like the parking and security. We had a garden view room on the ground floor with a very nice patio (room 413). The room was very close to all the offerings of the hotel. There were some sweet ants in the bathroom and on bedside table. We also found a worm in the bed one night. I did not complain because it is the tropics and we were on the ground floor, but the ants did kind of turn me off because we were paying over $400 a night. The pool was nice and refreshing. You can order food poolside and beachside from the pool bar and grill. The beach was nice however I didn't swim in the ocean or lay on the beach. Key West is not known for great beaches. We ate our New Year's Eve dinner at the Harborview Cafe and It was delicious. We had stone crab, salads and filets. The chef came around to every table to make sure the dinners were cooked well. The wine bar is nice too. They have music every night. Another bar at the hotel is called the Chart Room. It is a famous bar in the Keys. They have popcorn and happy hour which is fun. The showers were nice and tub was very deep which is good for soaking your feet after a long day of walking. We also ordered room service and it was delicious too. It was expensive, but room service always is! Great cheap breakfast across the street at Two Friend's restaurant. We also enjoyed Alonzo's and Conch Seafood Restaurants. Both are within 5 minutes. CVS across the street helps with any last minute items you forgot. We did not even really notice the construction going on. I would recommend this hotel because of the great location and easy access to many amenities, but be prepared to pay.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: igitaround27
Reviews.Content: On my first trip to Key West, the Pier House was very accommodating. The lobby staff were courteous and helpful. The heated pool was wonderful with a true deep end. The little beach was perfectly groomed and the water quite inviting with a real diving platform! I had several good meals at the on-site restaurant, where the service was impeccable. My room was spacious, comfortable and quiet, overlooking beautiful sub-tropical gardens. The hotel was located within walking distance to everying I wanted to see in Old Town.

Reviews.Title: “Nice for the beach, but...”
Reviews.Author: wander1
Reviews.Content: The Pier House is a very nice hotel but it is a beach hotel. Our room was very nice, the service was good, the price was moderate (considering it was December in Key West) and the hotel location itself was perfect. My only word of warning is the location of the rooms themselves. We stayed in the spa, which is a seperate building. The rooms are very spacious, with hardwood floors and a large whirpool tub. The "but" is the view from our room was of the parking lot and the room is right on Front Street across from several bars. Fun people watching from the balcony but don't expect peace and quiet. We would stay at The Pier House again and recommend it, but I suggest you do you make sure where your room is.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Hotel, Hated Spa!”
Reviews.Author: Lilka28
Reviews.Content: The hotel is nice with a great location close to main strip. Room was clean and comfortable, but I would not recommend the spa. Prices are high and service is terrible. I got manicure and pedicure done by the lady who was unprofessional and hostile. My husband who was getting the same service was outraged by unprofessional behavior toward clients. Donâ€™t get your nails done at that place!!!! They may cut your cuticles till you bleed. Also I got cut while she was using razor on my feet. I am not sure about other services at the Spa, but I wouldnâ€™t recommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great location. Be aware of nonstandard rate schedules in KW”
Reviews.Author: bondrey
Reviews.Content: Great location at end of Duval Street. Only a couple blocks to the late night party scene. A small beach by the bar, nice heated pool, told by friends (locals) the restaurant is really good. Overall pretty good little resort. The not-so-good: Can be noisy during big events due to the couple bars adjacent to the property. Spa services are expensive. We were upgraded to a suite because our 2-queen-bed room was needed by a family. It was nice and spacious with a tropical feel. It was expensive even with the standard room rate ($304 sat/sun, $209 wk days), but compared with rest of KW area prices were on par...in fact if you go by KW prices it was a reletive value. Still seems like a lot though. We didn't have a choice as our house was being packed out and we needed someplace to be for last few days there and all hotels in area were booked because of the world championship offshore boat races. That week had it's own rate schedule. Be aware KW does not do a standard summer/winter rate schedule! The on-season is winter; however, there are 'special' rate schedules with the local hotels that are not advertised. These include but not limited to: Lobster Fest in late July, Fantasy Fest in late Oct, Boat Race weeks twice a year, 6wks in spring for spring break, and holidays.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: hbjbmom
Reviews.Content: Park your car and walk or bike ride everywhere! This hotel is wonderful and in the best location on the island. Nice rooms - GET a 2ND FLOOR ROOM definiately! Pool is nice and beach is cute. If you don't care about the view, the Standard Room (again only on the 2nd floor) was a great room and inexpensive. The Chart Room is a great late night drinking place... and you don't have to stumble too far home!! Loved this place and will come back for sure!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Pier House - not the best”
Reviews.Author: jspang
Reviews.Content: We returned from the Pier House for a 3 night stay last week. The location of this resort is excellent. Just a short walk to everything. The people that worked there treated us great. The pool, beach and gardens were very nice. Anyone staying there, any age will be fine. We were very concerned about the construction and it didn't bother us at all even while we were at the beach area. Here's the catch. The cost of the rooms at this resort is very high but your paying for the location. We were very surprised on the condition and cleaniness of the rooms. If you walked across the carpet the bottom of your feet were black with dirt. In my opinion the rooms compared to an old "Days Inn" type room and we paid for a Harbor View room. This is just a honest opinion and I'm telling like it is so anyone staying here doesn't get their hopes to high for the price your going to pay.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't Stay Anywhere Else!”
Reviews.Author: counselme
Reviews.Content: This is probably the fifth time we have stayed at the Pier House and will definitely stay there again if plans allow for a trip to Key West. I can't say enough about the room, the location, and the services. The pool is wonderful, the beach is cute, the rooms are large and clean, and the people are so helpful. They even started their wonderful service before we got there this time by e-mailing recommendations for activities and restaurants (we tried one fo the suggestions - the Seven Fishes - and were extremely pleased with it). If you are looking for a quiet location that is also in the center of things - this is the place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful place to stay in Key West”
Reviews.Author: yaateyet
Reviews.Content: I got married at the Pier House and everything was wonderful. Food was excellent and the staff was so nice and accomodating. The beach area was a definite plus. It was a very special day for my husband and I. Highly recommended!!!!!!!!! Rooms were gorgeous.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to go back to the Pier House!”
Reviews.Author: DrinkiesRUs
Reviews.Content: Wow, we had a wonderful week in Key West from October 13th to the 20th and the Pier House was a wonderful place to stay. The staff were all very friendly, especially Todd the concierge, he was always ready to give us help and advice. We even used him to book some trips for us and make dinner reservations. The room itself was very clean and we had a nice view of the pool. We didn't have a lift to our floor but it didn't worry us as it was just the two of us so we dragged the cases up on the first day, and down on the day we left! Not a big deal for us. The food at the Pier House was wonderful and the breakfasts certainly set you up for the day. (try the Cuban French Toast !!) There was building work being done to the sundeck while we were there but it really didn't impede on our trip at all. If you were on the beach you could hear the noise but it really wasn't that bad and we were out and about a lot of the time anyway. We used the spa and had a great experience in there. The staff were very pleasant and the treatments were the same price that you would find at any spa, not inflated. If you are looking for somewhere close to Duval Street then this is the ideal place to stay! We were just a few minutes walk from Mallory Square, the Harbor for boating trips and the nightlife. We are looking forward to going back again real soon!

Reviews.Title: “great stay”
Reviews.Author: tmm93
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Pier House from 10/31/07 to 11/5/07. We stayed in a standard room. Our balcony overlooked Duval st., we could also see the harbour and sunset pier. The room had two double beds, beautiful bedding(lots of pillows). The mattress was very comfortable and it made for some great sleeping. The pool area was very nice and they had a waitress come pool side and get drinks, food or whatever. They have a computer set up in the Spa building so that you can print out boarding passes. The Chart Room bar is very dark and dingy (a little dive). We stopped in for one, just to say we had been there. I think the location is the best thing about the place. You are within walking distance of just about everything. There is construction ongoing, however, it never interfered in our stay. We slept and showered in the room, otherwise, did not spend much time in there, not because it wasn't nice, but because there is just so much to do outside the hotel. i would definetly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Roaches, No Elevator, Arrogant Bellman”
Reviews.Author: FloridaBruinsFan
Reviews.Content: Stay at the Hyatt next door...cleaner, bigger rooms, ELEVATOR and great staff! It's worth an extra $$ a night. Main building has two floors. If you are on the second floor and you anticipate use of a cooler, stroller, etc. during your stay good luck! We found out the hard way - lugging a stroller up and down stairs for 3 days. First mistake was not to use the bellman, not knowing an elevator did not exist we figured it should be easy enough to get our belongings to our room. Apparently that was a snub to the bellman as he was very rude to us the remainder of our stay. More than once we nearly took a spill down the stairs. However, the night crew seemed to outshine the day crew as the night crew was very nice and hospitable. Room was VERY small and had, what appeared to be ants. They had made an effort to update, but only went part way so their efforts seemed more like a poor attempt to cover up obvious deficiencies in the building rather than upgrading to "Resort-Like" atmosphere (new baseboards were already falling off the walls). I wont even get into the 2 dead roaches which were in the downstairs hallway for the last two days of our stay. Overall - Great beach (when construction is not going on), Rude Day Staff, Insects, Small Rooms, No Elevator and a poor attempt at upgrading

Reviews.Title: “Pier House Resort is Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: donna1128
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Pier House Resort and Spa 9/13-9/17 for a girls spa weekend. Hotel is beautiful. Everything about our stay was incredible. The hotel employees were very nice. The beach and swim area was clean. The food at the Pool Bar and Grille was excellent. Had the opportunity to have a massage. It was the best ever! The bed was the most comfortable I've ever slept in. The only downside was the very small bathroom. I had read about this from other reviews, however do not let it sway you from staying there. Can't wait to go back!!!

Reviews.Title: “Location Location Location”
Reviews.Author: DeeZDallas
Reviews.Content: I looked and looked at reviews to find a place with a beach and that was within walking distance of Duval St., Mallory Square, and restaurants....plus stay within my price range. The Pier House seemed to fit all my qualifcations. My husband and I found the room very nice and the staff very friendly. The beach is small...but it's a beach! We ordered Room Service for Breakfast and the service was prompt and the food delicious and we enjoyed lunches and having drinks at Pool/Beach Bar. We will definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Run-Down, Not Worth the Price”
Reviews.Author: CCChef
Reviews.Content: Great view looking out, but not looking in. Pier House has a great reputation, but they are living on a dream with the conditions of their rooms. Our $425 room had a great view of the bay. However, the conditions inside reminded me of a $75 room. Paint was chipping, carpet stained, bathroom not cleaned well, etc. Noise from adjoining room, through connecting door was extremely loud--even with the visiting couple just talking in normal tones. Would not visit again unless the price was less than half of the current price.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location with a Wonderful Spa!”
Reviews.Author: miaboston
Reviews.Content: We came here for an eight day and seven night stay. It was our first trip to Key West. The hotel staff was warm and courteous when we arrived and our room was even ready! It was about 12:30 pm. The room was clean and pretty and we had a lovely view of the pool and beach area. My husband loved being able to use the gym in the morning. I went to the spa and indulged in several wonderful massages. The people at the spa were very welcoming and made me feel great each day that I went. All of the massage experts were great but I really loved Mimi because she had a very calming spirit about her and she was incredibly warm. She gave me the hot stone massage and the coma massage. I and my husband also enjoyed a massage by Michael who was also very good. The last day Michelle gave me a deep tissue that was the deepest I ever felt. My shoulders ached from it but it was a good ache. The Spa was my favorite part of the resort. The pool was clean every time we went swimming and there were waitresses taking drink orders by the pool. The bartenders were all women which I really liked because I felt comfortable going there and ordering a drink if I wanted one. The concierge was nice and helpful in planning for my husband to have a fishing trip one of the days. He loved it and said it was perfect. I only ate once at the hotel, it was lunch at the beach. I had a papaya shrimp salad. It was very nice but there are so many delicious restaurants in Key West that I had to try them. The location of the hotel is better than fabulous. We rented a moped to get around and it was great fun. But if you do not you can walk to many places. Alonzo's restaurant down the street has a great happy hour between 4-6. It's half price drinks and the left side of the menu which has lots of raw bar selections and the best white clam chili and onion rings. We went every single day. They also make the tastiest Mojitos. On our last day the hotel gave us an extra hour to check out because our flight did not leave until 4:00pm. All in all it was a very restful and fun trip with lots of therapeutic help from the spa. It was a perfect trip. BTW... The housekeeping staff was great too! Our room was cleaned on time each day and it was always nice and fresh when we returned to it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value/Location/Amenities”
Reviews.Author: Stappers
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Pier house with my wife in May 2007 after booking out of another hotel in Key West (As it wasn't that nice) and wasn't disappointed. The hotel was very good value compared to what we had been paying. The first impression was that the room was nice. It was fairly basic but was pretty big and was clean. We also had a nice patio area with chairs which was tucked away and was a sun trap. The private hotel beach was excellent and although small wasn't busy while we were there and was nicer than the main public beach on the south of the island. It beat lying around a pool aswell. The bar/restaurant by the beach was good and the staff were attentive in taking drinks orders and providing beach loungers, tables and chairs. Although we didn't use the pool it looked good and had plenty of loungers around it aswell The location was excellent; right at the end of Duval street and at the lively end of the street at that. There are loads of restaurants and bars around the hotel. Also, Mallory park was only five mintues away where they have sunset festivals with street performers and drinks while watching the sun go down. This was well worth experiencing and wouldn't have known if someone hadn't mentioned it very close to the end of the holiday. The hotel reception were helpful from booking trips/laundry and also questions about Key West generally. This was a really nice friendly hotel and really made our holiday after checking out of the original hotel (Which is actually higher than the Pier house in the tripadvisor rankings). It had everthing we could possibly need but most of all the location was fantastic. We would definitely look to stay at this hotel again were we to go back which is very likely

Reviews.Title: “a bit of paradise”
Reviews.Author: beachesgalore
Reviews.Content: My visit to the Pierhouse Resort was the week of June 4th, this was my 2nd time there. The room was spacious and extremely clean. The beds were very comfortable and provided an excellent nights sleep. The beach was free of seaweed or debris and the water was clear and beautiful. I chose the Pierhouse because of its location at the end of Duval Street and Mallory Square. It is walking distance to most everything. The staff at check in/out at the front desk was super nice and efficient. The only staff problem I experienced was 2 days out of our weeks stay the man who gives out beach towels, chairs etc.. was rude, unfriendly and not pleasant at all. He could have just simply smiled a bit and not made me feel I was bothering him from his shaded post. My overall experience was a terrific one and I would recommend this resort to anyone who cares about swimming and having a nice but small beach area. There was construction going on at the restaurant and the jack hammer was annoying one day but that didn't bother me too much. I am sure the improvement will outweigh the temporary nuisance of construction.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, very nice grounds.”
Reviews.Author: Vinnie_Vegas
Reviews.Content: My fiance' and I drove down to Key West as a last minute trip for a 3 day weekend getaway and ended up at the Pier House after calling several hotels and finding no vacancy. The price was a bit more than I was expecting to pay for an out of season stay at $279 a night. We arrived late with no problems checking in and visible security in the parking lot. The front desk girl was friendly and aswered all of my questions. We were pleased to find that the pool/ hot tub areas were open all night to enjoy a nice soak and cocktail from the bar after a long drive. The room itself was very large and tastefully decorated and also had an LCD tv & coffee maker. The bed was great with a crazy amount of pillows on it. The only bad thing about the room was the water pressure. I was also kind of irked that the wifi was not included - I hate when high end hotels nickle & dime you for something that costs nothing extra and is provided free at most of the smaller lodges around town. The grounds of the hotel were very well kept and provided a nice tropical landscape. The pool area was nice also - clean with plenty of seating and view of the sea. This hotel is in a great location right at the end of Duval st - close enough to all the good bars but also right on the water and they have their own little beach near the pool and bar. Less than a 5 minute walk over to Mallory square for all the sunset hooplah. There was also a scooter rental right at the hotel parking lot which we took advantage of and had good service.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: LovestotravelfromNJ
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Pier House for our honeymoon in May 2006. The location was perfect right at the end of Duval St. The only drawback was that the rooms that have jacuzzi tubs only face the street, across from which is a bar so a few nights we were woken up by glass beer bottles being thrown en masse into the garbage as well as hearing the bar crowd. Management was very understanding and reduced our rate since they did not have another room to move us to. I would skip the massages, they were overpriced and disappointing. The room was wonderful and once again the location was great.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at Pier House...too bad it was cut short!”
Reviews.Author: triciaanne
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked four nights at the Pier House under their â€œGourmet Getawayâ€� package for early March 2007. After a horrendous vacation in the Dominican Republic, we booked this trip as a do-over so we could forget about that awful mistake. We were very pleased with the Pier House and hope to return again. BOOKING: The package we wanted was only available by booking with Pier House directly and it was an easy process. A few days after I made the reservation, I decided to upgrade to a spa room and it was not a problem. The Gourmet Getaway package is for four nights ($440 per night, plus $50 to upgrade to spa room), breakfast is included every morning along with two dinners at One Duval, their main restaurant. We also received about 15 drink coupons that were good for the various bars at the resort. CHECK IN: Very convenient and quick. We were in our room in about 5 minutes. There is ample parking and we were able to find a spot within a few feet of the spa building. ROOMS: If booking a spa room, ask for a ground floor room that faces the garden path in the back. These rooms have little French doors that open up on to small patios and you will be very close to the spa hot tub. We loved our room...we were just a few steps from the hot tub and were the only guests using it at night. Pier House staffers use the garden path, so they will stroll by every now and then. We weren't bothered by it. The spa rooms are very spacious and nicely decorated, but are starting to show their age. There were some small chunks missing from the Pergo floors (looked like someone had tried to move furniture on their own), the bathtub was chipped, and one of our sinks was cracked, but didnâ€™t leak. Overall, these are minor complaints and they did not interfere with our ability to enjoy the room. But, for nearly $500 per night, I can see how this would bother some people. Our room had a flat screen TV and a stereo system, so bring some CDs with you. You will need them because one of the bars near Pier House has this awful singer who goes until 11pm most nights. I thought about going over and giving this guy a giant tip so he would stop singing. Two cats fighting would sound better than this guy. I would suggest renting a mini fridgeâ€”itâ€™s only $10 for the entire stay. You can stock it up with stuff from CVS across the street and one of the nearby liquor stores. SERVICE: We found the staff at Pier House friendly and helpful. All requests were honored quickly and without any hassle. Todd, the concierge, assisted us with bike rentals and arranged for us to take a sunset cruise on the Appledore, which we enjoyed. He was much more helpful than concierges I've encountered elsewhere. FOOD: Meals at Pier House can be expensive, so the package deal more than paid for itself. Breakfast would run about $30 - $40 and dinner would be around $120 -$130. Some of our favorite dishes were the crab cakes benedict, the omelets, the lobster pasta, the filet mignon, and the stuffed lobster. We thought the food was good. The menu is relatively basic and could use a little more creativity, but we were very happy with all of our meals. On the package deal, you can pretty much order anything on the menu, including specials. The only item we were told we could not order was the lobster and filet surf and turf that was a special one night. The service in the restaurants is friendly and attentive, but not intrusive. Tips are included with the meal package, but we tipped anyway. All of the servers initially tried to decline the tips, but we insisted. BEACH AND POOL: The beach is very small, but Pier House is one of the few places on the island that has its own beach. We preferred the pool, which was never overly crowded. Weâ€™d sometimes have to wait an hour or two in a less than ideal location before some lounge chairs would open up in the sunny spots, but not a big deal. We still managed to get nicely browned. There is drink service by the pool if youâ€™re feeling lazy. Otherwise, you can get up and walk the 25 feet over to the bar. THE EMERGENCY: Unfortunately, on the morning of our third day, I got a call from back home about a serious family emergency. We had to leave almost immediately since we had driven down to Key West from New Jersey and needed to get home as soon as possible. The staff at Pier House was very understanding and compassionate. We spoke to the front desk and they assured us that even though their cancellation policy is seven days, they would refund us for our unused night. A few days later, I checked my credit card account online and sure enough, they had credited us the amount for the room. Pier House really came through for us. Just based on the kindness they showed us, Iâ€™d definitely return. We had originally planned to take a leisurely ride home spending two nights in Savannah, two nights in Charleston, and a night in Virginia. The other hotels would not refund our money because of their cancellation policies. These other hotels told us that policies are policies and if they bent the rules for us, theyâ€™d have to bend them for all guests. Even though our trip was cut short and we missed our dinner at Little Palm Island, which we were really looking forward to, we loved our stay in Key West. We hope to get back to Pier House sometime next year.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing resort”
Reviews.Author: mgoose
Reviews.Content: We have visited Key West before. This was our 2nd trip with my husband, and sister and brother-in-law. We love the island. This was ouir first visit to the Pierhouse and stayed there March 8th thru March 12, 2007. The resort is very tropical. The pool is nice and clean. The beach area is very nice and the outdoor bar/restaurant is wonderful. The food was always good. The sunset deck is perfectly located for watching the sunset everynight. The resort is very close to Mallory Square. The staff at the resort was very nice too. The only problem were the rooms. They need updating badly. The beds and bathroom were clean, but the rooms need to be painted and the rugs changed. You see dirt on the rugs and markings on the walls. You need to book rooms early, because the closer you get to the date, the price goes way up. All in all, enjoyed the stay there.

Reviews.Title: “My honeymoon is already off to a bad start”
Reviews.Author: addieusc
Reviews.Content: When picking our hotel for our honeymoon, we avoided many resorts because they were expecting to have construction. We decided to book at Pierhouse instead because of the lack of construction and their features. I just received an email yesterday (6 weeks before my wedding/honeymoon) that they are planning for demolition of their two restaurants and construction of new suites beginning May 1 and continuing thru June! My honeymoon kicks off on May 20!!! I work in property management and I'm not a fool...they had to have been planning this project for months and decided not to notify their guest until less than a month prior to their start date. Of course, pretty much everywhere else in Key West that has the features we want is now book solid. So we're left with the Pierhouse. Its very inconvenient and inconsiderate of their entire staff and management team. On a good note, when I called the resort after receiving the email, the lady who I spoke with was very polite and honest. They have offered us a 25% discount rate for every night but Saturday; however, they could not tell us whether or not we were going to be near the construction and did not deny that it will be loud. Although I appreciate her honesty and her willingness to help, I think that's pretty bad customer service. They need to offer a better discount than that considering the situation - honeymoon, not notifying us until now, not knowing where our room is in relation to the construction site, etc. Even if we are placed away from the site and are not too greatly affected when we're there, I will not book through this resort again and I will make sure to tell anyone who is considering Key West to do the same. Its very hard to be optimistic and this is the last thing a bride needs 6 weeks before her wedding!

Reviews.Title: “Pier House -- Never Again!”
Reviews.Author: Gumpper
Reviews.Content: When I called for a reservation, I specifically asked for a room that would be quiet. So, imagine my consternation at being put in a room almost directly across the street from a bar that features bad Southern rock on a roof deck until midnight. It was as if they were playing right on our balcony!! Management's response -- "we have nothing else available." Well, Key West was booked solid for the weekend, so we dealt with it, but I'll never stay at the Pier House again.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: wooman
Reviews.Content: Reading these reviews had me kinda worried about this place to be honest. We stayed in the Caribbean Spa Suite, it was nice, clean and modern. Fairly quiet too, some times would hear the live entertainment at the Rum Barrel at night, but that's to be expected. It had a balcony and the view was of the Hyatt's parking lot. We didn't mind since we're not the type to make an issue of that and we weren't in our room much. The only issue was that my wife is 6 months pregnant and getting out of the deep whirlpool tub was difficult. There was no separate shower. I didn't see a "standard" room, but the main building(s) were cinder-block, so assuming other reviews here maybe some what accurate. The pool area is nice with the gardern surrounding it. However, the pool water's temp could have been a little cooler. It was like bathwater and not very refreshing when I came back from fly fishing in the flats. The beach was nice too great view of the keys and bay. Lot of activity in the water during the day, but yet kinda peaceful watching and laying on the beach. The Atlantic side there are public beaches, but not much scenery in my opinion. The resort is in walking distance of all the major activities and sites on Duval St., Truman's Little White Hse, the marine north of the resort and Mallory Sq. If you want to be in the middle of everything, but escape to some peace and quiet then this resort is worth looking into. We didn't have any issues with the staff and Bill (concierge) helped me book a jet boat and was very helpful. I agree that it may be pricey, but if you're willing to spend it then I suggest getting a suite. Not necessarily an ocean view either since they do have a beach, bar and restaurant for your viewing pleasure. Overall my wife and I had an enjoyable time at the resort and would consider coming back.

Reviews.Title: “Bitterly Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: RedmondWicklow
Reviews.Content: Having just left the Gardens Hotel in Key West this was a bitter disappointment. It is not a cheap hotel. We paid $529 per night for an ocean view room but the wash basin was very badly cracked, the ceiling was dirty, the electrical ducting to the ceiling fan was rusting and the bedlinen looked grey rather than white. It took too days for our request to restock the minibar to be completed. It aslo took two days to get a response to our complaint about the wash basin. The entire operation was totally impersonal and lacked any character. The size of the reception area was totally inadequate. I can not recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: odessaphiles
Reviews.Content: Where to start. Pier House is located just north of Mallory Square. My wife and I have visited Key West numerous times and have stayed at a variety of places. this one is the best, but you pay for it, $350 a pop/night. we had the bay view and as you can tell, we had a great view. It is centrally located to where we visit while there, never more than a 15 minutes walk from our destinations. HOWEVER, it is just a normal hotel room. It is pretty nice with a great view, but everything is overpriced. $6 for an egg for breakfast? It is peaceful and not as boisterous as you would expect in Key West and at night it is rather quiet. The staff was very nice and helpful. If you're interested in a centrally located Mallory Square place to stay, this is it. If the price is too steep, there are other places to stay that are not so expensive within the area. ALSO, at no time during our 5 day stay did a cruise ship block our view as it does at the Hyatt and Ocean Key. This is important info if you request a bay view balcony.

Reviews.Title: “The Pier House needs an "extreme makeover"”
Reviews.Author: buttercake
Reviews.Content: Not worth the money. My husband and I had reservations for the first three nights of our 5 night stay in Key West..We booked through AAA and found that the AAA room is not that great of a deal.We were on the second floor over the hotel entry.The balcony view of Duval was totally blocked by a huge tree. The bathroom was super small and needs a re-do (baseboards missing,aging walls) It definitely was not the "Pier House" that you may have heard about in years past. The beach area was nice,friendly staff. The exercise room was terrible...really bad treadmills. It looked like my spare room at home....a place to store all of the exercise equipment that isn't being used. Overall it was a 5 out of 10.

Reviews.Title: “We hope to come back soon!!”
Reviews.Author: SandanKen
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Pier House Resort and Spa for a week in July 2005 for our honeymoon. We booked a Harborview Room and were not disappointed. We had the best seat in the house for the famous Key West Sunsets. We would return every night just before sunset and enjoy and photograph the memorable sunsets in the privacy and quiet of our own room and on our own private balcony. The entire staff at the Pier House was very friendly and helpful - they did all they could to help make the stay enjoyable. The location is second to none; just a short walk to the bristling excitement of Duvall Street, yet while on the Pier House premises, it is quiet and relaxing. The beach and pool are small, but clean and enjoyable. The Chart Room is a great place to escape the crowds of Duvall Street and sit and have a nightcap before turning it. It's a very quaint, comfortable, friendly pub. The price of the room was fair, given the ambience and the convenience to everything - and it was kept very clean. We absolutely loved our stay at Pier House and will return again soon. We highly recommend it!! Ken and Lorie, Westerly, Rhode Island

Reviews.Title: “Just okay....”
Reviews.Author: islandhopper2007
Reviews.Content: This is a great location being at the beginning of Duval. It has a rare private beach, including one that is topless. The pool is open 24 hours. There is a sunset bar where you can see an amazing sunset. Our room had a beautiful terrace that was next to the koi pond which was quite private. The problems...the room was not very clean. There were dead bugs, some type of flying insect, all over the bathroom floor. The bathroom was very, very tiny. You can barely close the door. The television had a lot of static and the speakers were blown. There was a lot of noise as the walls are very thin! There is an envelope with the maids name where you can include gratuity. After leaving a few dollars in the envelope, the bugs were finally swept up. I received a significant AAA discount which helps to justify my stay here. Otherwise, I would never pay full price for this hotel. If you enjoy the private beach area and the great location on Duval, this may be worth it. I found that it is far too easy to stay somewhere else and take a cab to Duval.

Reviews.Title: “Love the Spa”
Reviews.Author: lighthouselovertoo
Reviews.Content: This is rating only the spa, but we want to recomend it highly. My friend had a pedicure during our recent visit to Key West. That gave both of us access to their lovely facility. Highly recomended!

Reviews.Title: “Staff Needs PR Training”
Reviews.Author: HomerHarley
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for 4 nights. As stated many times in reviews on this property, the location is fantastic. In general our room was nice... a little quirky perhaps. An example would be a bathroom door that would not close without hitting the toilet. I really had to put some effort into closing that door. The funny part was that the door was actually notched out so it would clear the toilet...it didn't. Some of this staff need training in dealing with people. When we were checking in, another guest stepped in front of us, and the desk clerk reprimanded him in a way which embarrassed everyone. Later when the front desk received a call from our dive group asking them to notify us of the cancellation of the dive, they never bothered to let us know. They also did not contact us when an envelope was left for us by someone else. We had to ask them for it the next day. One porter was consistently surly. Although he did hold doors open for me, he did not speak to me or respond to my expression of thanks. I think I got a grunt once. Other reviews spoke about an unfriendly concierge. During our stay, the concierge went out of his way to be helpful. When he wasnâ€™t there, a woman took his place, and she did a good job also. The head of housekeeping was very friendly. She came to my rescue one day when I was trying to find my room. She actually walked me the entire way back. Our meals, breakfast and lunch, at the restaurant were good. The first day we were there, the pigeons were a little annoying. The staff put strings above the eating area to deter them. This was actually effective. The staff at the Caribbean Spa do an excellent job. Yumi gave me an outstanding manicure and pedicure. I would never have believed than anyone but a podiatrist could help my sore feet as much as she did. It was a nice get-away. I will definitely try to back to the spa again. Stay at the hotel again....Iâ€™m not so sure.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Retreat”
Reviews.Author: CPUK
Reviews.Content: Stayed here one night as I did some 15 years earlier and it is still a very nice property. Check in was efficient and the room overlooking the harbour and front of the hotel (the cheaper option) was fantastic with air con and ceiling fan. Situated at the end of Duval Street and almost on Mallory Square the location could not be improved upon. The gardens, grounds and private beach are great as is the free parking for cars. We had a lot of heavy luggage so a room on the upper floor was a disadvantage since the property doesn't appear to have a lift but this was a minor point. At breakfast the waiter brought my companion the wrong dish (he probably misheard due to the power boat racing we were watching!) He could not have been more apologetic and insisted we could have the original plus the correct one. The only bad thing about the whole experience was the thought that in 24 hours we would have to swap the 85 degrees sunshine for the 40 degrees of a grey UK but that isn't something Pier House could help us with. Hope it isn't another 15 years before I return!

Reviews.Title: “Cancelled and went elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: TeresaJG
Reviews.Content: We were booked in at the Pier House for 5 Nights, but ended up cancelling after 2 nights. The room we were allocated was awful in every way. The location was terrible, it was ground floor and overlooked the carpark. There was little natural light in the room and opened onto a shared terrace which was ugly, dirty and noisey from the air conditioning unit. (and who wants to sit outside and look at a car park?). The bathroom was so small you had to squeeze inside and shut the door before you could move around in it. The towels were folded up underneath an extractor fan, that was so mouldy, I had to shake black mould off the towels before using them. The bathroom sink leaked all over the floor. The room was small and unatttractive. The common areas of the hotel are basically ugly and remind you of an underground car park. The pool looked very nice, but one of my pet hates is supposedly upmarket hotels that make you sign for a pool towel before allowing you to take one - VERY TACKY!! Even worse is finding a bottle of water in your room and then discovering that they charge you for it, and an unreasonably high cost at that!! We were offered a better room with a gulf view, but for an extra $150 per night!! We declined and left. Not impressed. Wouldn't return.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: fromNS
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at the Pier House in June of 2006. Before we booked it, I read numerous reviews on this and other sites. Some good, some not so good. I think what most travelers need to realize is that Key West is a unique place, with which comes a unique outlook/attitude from the locals. I'm hesitant to use the phrase 'party-central', but Key West, especially Duval Street is always busy, with loads of tourists enjoying the many bars, restaurants and attractions. The location of the Pier House is excellent - at the very beginning of Duval Street. Naturally, if you choose to stay in the middle of the action, you must also be prepared to hear a bit of the action from your room. It's rather difficult to get a real picture of the resort from their website, so I'll try to explain. The Pier House is a cluster of buildings, all opening on beautiful garden courtyard. The courtyard also contains a nice pool/hot tub. There are guest rooms in the "Atrium" building, which offers views on one side of the pool and atrium/garden area. The other side of the hall overlooks either the parking lot, or the front of the hotel (beyond the parking lot is Duval Street) - These are the rooms which others have commented as being noisy - they're also the cheaper rooms. The "Conch" building is adjacent to the atrium building and offers similar views. There's a newer building on the waterfront (I think it was called the beach house, but not sure of the name). This building has views of the water, or atrium, and is the most expensive of all. Trying to do our trip "on the cheap", we booked a standard room - Rm 187. The room was on the ground floor in the atrium building, and had a small patio on the garden, but was next to the hotel bar. Yes, the hallways are made of cementblocks, which doesn't give the best first impression, but you must also realize that due to the tropical design of the building, the hallways are not completely interior - although there are rooms on both sides of the halls, the end opens onto the outdoor courtyard - hence the outdoor-like materials used to construct the halls. The room itself was pleasant, the AC was rather noisy, bathroom small, but overall it was clean and comfortable, although I don't think I'd classify it as a 4-5 star. Other reviews have mentioned this room in particular as being especially noisy and generally not nice. Once again, if you choose to book the cheapest room in the hotel, you cannot expect to receive the room in the brochure or website. We were so tired from site seeing each night that we fell right to sleep, and weren't bothered by any noise. The staff was OK, but again, exhibiting that 'who cares' Key West attitude. I asked the front desk for an feather pillow at 10pm (the ones in the rooms are really hard and foam). I was told to check back in the morning!?!? "But I'm not sleeping in the morning, I'm sleeping now", I said. Still, no pillow - just check back in the morning?!?! There is security on site 24 hours, who keeps non-guests off of the private (topless) beach and pool. The pool/hot tub is open 24 hours, but be aware: it is closed every Wednesday from 10pm to 8am on Thursday morning for the weekly chemical treatment. (Something they don't tell you until you arrive!) Overall, I feel the Pier House is a good choice for anyone who wants to get out and walk around the city without the fuss of driving around (parking for one vehicle is included - parking is not easy to find in Key West). If you book a cheaper room, be prepared for something not quite as nice as the pics on the website, and something which may be a little on the noisy side. Regardless of the decor/location of your room, the pool and grounds are nice, hotel is generally clean, and a wonderful location.

Reviews.Title: “perfect 10 vacation”
Reviews.Author: kooz
Reviews.Content: After 2 years without a vaction nothing but smiles help and clean fresh rooms everyday my wife and I are ready to book again and have told friends of an amazing time great job to all the staff MARK FROM MI.

Reviews.Title: “Above Average”
Reviews.Author: MelinDallas
Reviews.Content: My girlfriends and I stayed at the Pier House last October right before Hurricane Wilma headed over that way. Pluses: Location - It is right in the heart of where you need to be. Minutes from shopping, restaurants, bars, nightlife, etc. We never took a cab anywhere on island. It has a beach. Most hotels on this island do not have beaches as Key West really isn't known for it's beach space. The fact that they have this is nice, if it's what you want to do. The gardens are beautiful. It is landscaped very nicely and has a very luxurious and tropical feel. Staff. They were very friendly. Recommended some WONDERFUL restaurants. If you go to Key West, there is a sushi restaurant that is on one of the main streets that is the best sushi I have had in my life!!! Ask the guy at the front desk. Also, there's an italian restaurant called Antonio's - order the steak with the balsamic sauce. Incredible. I'm craving it! Minuses: The rooms weren't that updated. They had decent bathrooms and ammenities, but were not that attractive. The A/C unit kept leaking and it smelled pretty musty in the room the entire time. We asked maintenance to fix it, but they said it was normal condensation drip. Seemed like a lot to me. The carpet was soaked. Overall though, it was a good stay. I absolutely LOVE key west. Take the conch train tour, go to Sloppy Joe's after hours, take the tour of the island. We also took a day catamaran trip with water sports which was a lot of fun. If you're considering on whether to go to Key West or somewhere like Cancun/Mexico, you need to go to Key West. I've been to Mexico about 7 times. In Key West, it's not as expensive, you dont have to worry about the crime activity, everywhere is safe, and everyone speaks english. You also don't have to worry about the water quality--you're still in the US!

Reviews.Title: “Pier House was relaxing and fun!”
Reviews.Author: Nanook_of_Northeast
Reviews.Content: Just returned from the Pier House. My wife and I were travelling on our 10th anniversary. Our stay was spectacular from check in to departure. We booked an oceanfront room. The room was perfect with an extrememly comfortable bed and an extra large balcony overlooking the gulf of Mexico. My wife and I have been to Key West four other times and as a former employee of Starwood Hotels always stayed at the Sheraton Suites which was nice but was too far away from the nightlife. At the Pier House you are a hop skip and a jump away from all the action but when you are at the beach or pool you feel like you are at a more secluded resort. Key West is our favorite vacation spot and will be back there again and wouldn't hesitate to book the Pier House again.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Hotel, Questionable Service”
Reviews.Author: Southfloridian
Reviews.Content: We travel to Key West at least once a year. Traditionally, we've stayed at the Ocean Key Resort (which is right across Duval Street from the Pier House). But, we've wanted to give the Pier House a try for the past few years. So we stayed there last week. The Pier House is perfectly located right on the water at the end of Duval Street, close to all of the Key West "action". We booked a harbor view room with had a big balcony overlooking the Gulf and a small balcony on the opposite side overlooking the pool with Duval Street in the distance. The room was fantastic. No complaints of any kind. There is some construction occuring right now, but that didn't interfere with our stay too much. My disappointments are associated with the staff. I am a very frequent traveller and am generally accostumed to standard levels of service. Keeping in mind that we were paying nearly $400 a night for our room, one expects that at least standard service levels should be in place. Now, I'm not hard to please. In fact, I am extremely easy going. Yet, the folks at the Pier House found a way to get on my nerves. We'll begin with check-in. By way of comparison, the Ocean Key Resort sends a bellperson to your room with you so as it will be easy to find, and they take the opportunity to show you where the pool is, tell you about any happenings, get you acquainted with the restaurants, etc. The person at the desk of the Pier House told us our room number and pointed out the door saying "it's that way." The Pier House is comprised of several buildings, laid out in a "village", so room numbers are not as clear as in a single building hotel. After passing buildings with room numbers in the 800's and 100's and unsuccessfully finding ours, we returned to the lobby. This time, they found us a bellman (who didn't take our bags on a cart) and he led us to about what would be the halfway point to our room, pointed towards a building and said "it's in there" and then left. Again, we were on our own to figure out the numbering system. We spent another 10 minutes walking down hallways and around the building before we found it. Second disappointment was at breakfast the next morning. We ate at an outdoor patio restaurant that was plagued with pigeons. No problem, they just kind of hung around the tables, not too bothersome. However, one of the waiters thought it was fun to "shoo" them with a squirt bottle, causing them to fly away over diners heads. Even with some audible negative comments from other guests, he didn't take the hint and continued to spray away the pigeons which then became extremely annoying in their departures and returns. What he should have done is left them alone and attended to the tables he was completely ignoring in the mean time. Instead, we got food pitched at us and not a return visit until we were asked "you done?" Third disappointment came on check out day. Again, I travel all the time, I fly at least once or twice a month. Typically (everywhere from Ritz Carlton to Hampton Inn) I get the lobby concierge to print out a boarding pass for me in the morning. They are always cordial and are used to the request. Not so at the Pier House, I was instead directed to a "pay per use" internet kiosk in the lobby. "That's what it's there for" I was told. So, I walked across the street, saw the concierge who recognized me at the Ocean Key Resort, told him that I wasn't staying there this time, but asked if he could print out the pass for me. "No problem" was the response. Oh well, back to Ocean Key next year.

Reviews.Title: “Going Downhill”
Reviews.Author: edepaul
Reviews.Content: Basically, no one asked if a room by where they were doing noisy construction(most of the waterfront rooms balconies)and the whole back stairwell was ok with us until we noticed it walking out to beach area and said something.Two hours later we got a room on third floor where there was supposedly less noise, and still didn't get the refrigerator I had requested. We were told work was only from 10-4 and would only last for one more day, when it was actually 8-6 and work was still going on days later after we left. It was so windy (high seas) this first week of October that we were stuck at the hotel beach listening to noisy construction, looking at construction men, and smelling balcony sealant the whole time we were there, and dealing with extremely rude and obnoxious, beach chair boys. Not at all the pleasant and relaxing Pier House that we remembered coming to over the years. The manager had said he would get back to me on Thursday after I had gone to him after the second beach chair man was so verbally rude, and he never did, and he was conveniently off Friday on checkout. The check out staff didn't apologize or even offer to have the manager call me . They must have new management and are going downhill. I recommend staying at the a larger hotels like the Ocean Key or Westin nearby where even if they are doing some construction you can get away from it easier , and offer much better customer service for the same rate ! And maybe first find out what level of construction they are doing, at the Ocean Key they were just painting the balcony railings for example not drilling or sanding off the surface of the balconies and steps, then applying a chemical sealant.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Key West and the Pier House”
Reviews.Author: freemach
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went to Key West the end of September 2006. It was one of the best vacations we ever had. The Pier House was absolutely beautiful. The staff was helpful and pleasant. I can't understand how anyone could have given this hotel a bad review. My husband and I couldn't find one thing wrong with it and believe me my husband is fussy! We stayed in a standard room and it was more than adequate. Considering you are hardly in the room. The small beach was great! I don't think there is another hotel that has a beach and it was nice to be able to hang out there. The food was excellent at the Duval Restaurant. The pool and spa were clean and a nice size. The best is where the Pier House is located it is right at the end of Duvall Street and you are in walking distance of everything. You have to check out the bar Sloppy Joes it's a fun place, good bands. If this is your first time going to Key West, Duvall Street is where all the action is. You can just walk from bar to bar drinking or store to store shopping. Don't forget to go to the Sunset Deck Bar at the Pier House for a drink and to watch the sunset, it's beautiful and romantic. I wouldn't suggest going to Mallory Square for the sunset unless you are looking for chaos which is what you will find there with all kinds of magicians and crazy performers and if a cruise ship comes in you won't see much of the sunset. We had a lot of fun and we can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent choice for a luxury stop”
Reviews.Author: Marykatesmom
Reviews.Content: I wasn't crazy to go to Key West with the kids but was up for an adventure so we joined another family and went for three nights. I picked the Pier House based on reviews here and the fact it had a small beach a rarity on the island. I'm so glad we went! Due to some renovations we were upgraded to an ocean front room and the other family got a suite. We were both very happy. The front desk was wonderfully attentive and always helpful. The bed's were heavenly. Extremely comfortable and the air conditioning perfect. A small downside is the air conditioning exhaust is on the patio, making the 90 degree heat all that much hotter. We ate in at the pool restaurant twice and despite it being offseason and the restaurant empty, the food was very good. The french fries were excellent. The staff was very friendly and great with the kids. The beach area is quite small but there is a floating dock the kids enjoyed and it was all that we needed. One small downside is the lack of shade. However, since we were the only customer's at the bar/snack area she let us stay there since we could watch the kids from there. The only other shady area was the topless beach directly under the rooms and although no one was topless we didn't want to risk it. The pool was heavenly and not at all crowded. The grounds were gorgeous and the location was perfect. The Pier House or the Ocean Key Resort across the street have the best location on the Island. Steps from everything yet there is no noise whatsoever. Once you cross onto the grounds you feel you've gone miles for the crowds on Duval St. Although we booked a garden room next time I'll spend the extra and get the Ocean view like we ended up with. I enjoyed my coffee looking out at the sailboats docked offshore. It isn't the typical Ocean view like Miami, ect. but just a s enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Very Acceptable!”
Reviews.Author: SCFunTraveler
Reviews.Content: Our first stay at the Pier House, having stayed twice at The Ocean Key House some years ago, (before it was re-modelled), and once at The Curry Mansion Inn. We had a great stay, notwithstanding some average service at check-in/front desk and at The Chart House Bar. We put this as much down to the general style of doing things in Key West as opposed to a specific problem at The Pier House. Housekeeping did an excellent job. There are some parts of the resort that could do with some renovation, but everything was clean that we came into contact with. Gardens are superb. "Free" use of the spa excercise room and steam room was great. Facility was quiet and spotless. Ate breakfast twice at One Duval and dinner twice also. Excellent on all occasions. Good after dinner entertainment. To us there is inherent value in staying at a full service, self-sufficient resort. We love to be out on Duval but sometimes it is just nice to be able to take a break and kick back in-house.

Reviews.Title: “Best of Key West”
Reviews.Author: bbgak
Reviews.Content: We stayed during Fantasy Fest (this is a late add, since I just found out about Trip Advisor, but I think helpful to those who may go for Fantasy Fest in the future). I was worried about finding the right hotel and having beach access and the Pier House was perfect. My husband found the place from a Key West expert and we had it booked 9 months in advance. The pools were lovely and beach was small but nice. I was worried about the craziness of Fantasy Fest, since I really don't enjoy that stuff, but being at the Pier House made it nice. We got to attend the Pretenders in Paradise party/costume event, which was a whole different side to the event and very nice. The hotel was very specific about beach access and changes to the hotel property leading up to the event and tore down the stage very quickly after. We got to see the talent rehearse which was fun too and some of the celebrities that attended. I enjoyed having the hotel close to the parade route to see all the floats and people. It was neat to watch. My husband enjoyed venturing out to Duval Street to see the people and costumes at night - for the most part it was just people dressing up in costume and entertaining but there were some seedy people and lots of guys running around with lighted video cameras trying to get people on tape who were behaving badly. For me, I could watch for an hour or so, then it got boring. There was a street fair with vendors one afternoon as well that a lot of people seemed to enjoy. You are paying for privacy and beach access at this hotel. Most of the hotels at this time of year are geared toward the partiers and just have pools. This is probably one of the nicest hotels on the island with the best service available on the island. Remember this is a laid back place with a different pace. The hotel staff were friendly and offered lots of recommendations on places to eat and see. The beach is not big, but nice. I enjoyed having drinks and lunch (try the conch friitters) delivered to me at the beach every day, while there for five days. We took advantage of the fridge rental and stocked up on water, beer, mixers, and wine to enjoy without having to add to our bar bill. No one ever looked strangely at us. We enjoyed breakfast at the market place one morning, but mostly ventured out for other meals to local type places. I would love to go back and eat a 1 Duval Street at Sunset and Blue Moon, which we were unable to get into at that time. The property was close to everything, though we rented bikes for a few days to see more of the island. We enjoyed the Hemmingway House, Smathers Beach, the Lighthouse. We parked our car at the hotel and only moved it a couple times - this is a walking town. Also recommend going to see the view from one of the taller hotels to see the whole island. We loved the local artists and bought a lot of art from street vendors near the southernmost point. They are nice reminders of out time here. I loved the unique jewelry at the Emerald Lady, and hope to go back and get some pirate booty there some day. Our room was fine - on the first level of the garden near the pool. I was a little worried about security especially with all going on at the hotel and in town, but we had no problems. We wanted a King bed, but oly two doubles were available. The bedding could be upgraded at a place like this though. We had a nice terrace and the room was thoroghly cleaned daily. I would definately go back, not sure about Fantasy Fest again, but I think my husband will insist upon it. I don't think there is any better place to stay in Key West and would look forward to staying at the Pier House again.

Reviews.Title: “dirty, very dirty”
Reviews.Author: dadinha
Reviews.Content: June 2, 2006 I stayed at the Pier House, in a duplex suite that was just awful. The room smelled badly and the bathroom was so dirty and full of hair that we had to call housekeeping... The next day we changed to a regular room that was nicer but also very poorly mantained and for $500 bucks we could get a better deal in a better hotel!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place and Location!”
Reviews.Author: breaks007
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Pier House this past May 2006. It was everything we read about in this Trip Advisor spot and then some--- considering only the good reviews. We think the place is great and would definately come back! Loved the beach and pool area but most of all its location on the Gulf and having an opportunity of seeing a sunset every night. We feel there is a lot to do in Key West; renting a car helps. Check out Smathers Beach and the Southern most continental point near by. Tour the area and have some fun! and what better place to come back to relax in. The Tiki Bar is next door and the cruise ships are just a step away as is Mallory Square. We've stayed in many hotels in our life and I think this place deserves the best of reviews for its 4 star class. So have a great time at the Pier House! WeI don't understand the few poor reviews??

Reviews.Title: “loved it”
Reviews.Author: treasure99
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I spent 7 days in Keywest at the Pier house. Best vacation ever. Loved it We didn't want to leave. The Pier house was wonderful. We had a garden room over looking the pool and was lovely. Very clean and quiet. We loved the pool and the beach. We used the beach more. The topless part of yhe beach was nice It is done in good taste. It is seprate from the rest of the beach. So you are not uncomfortbale with it. We enjoyed all of it. Would love to return someday cheryl

Reviews.Title: “Great Place Very Accommodating”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Like many people I checked these reviews out before going down to Key West. My wife and I were supposed to spend 3 days in Key West and 4 in Key Largo. While driving from the Miami airport to Key West, we decided that Key West seemed more fun and so we called our travel agent to see if we could get our Key Largo reservation moved to Key West. The Pier House was very accommodating with that request and was able to help us. So on that note, the Pier House started off great in my book. We arrived to find a wonderful room. Its not the typical rectangle room, it was more of a square area which held the bed, tables, and lamps, with an extra area off the rectangle for the sink and shower. The sink was outside of the shower area which was nice because you don't have to worry about standing in a sauna after you showered. The shower area was a little small but your not living there so who cares. If you do stay there, request to be in the Atrium building in Room 294. You get a view of Duval St and a side view of the ocean and sunset. Its great!!! The room had wood laminate flooring, new looking tile in the bathroom area. The room had a lot of open space and you really didn't feel like you were in the standard hotel room. We didn't really watch much TV but they had a Flat Panel HD in the room. It was great. The bed was not hard and the sheets were very comfortable. Now, I mentioned we asked if they could accommodate us for 4 more days. They could not keep us in our original room, they mentioned we had to pay for an upgraded room to stay the other days. Now after this first room, I wondered what could an upgrade bring. Nothing.... Nothing.... but a standard hotel room with a side view of the ocean facing the marina. Also there was no balcony, where the balcony was they had enclosed an area with glass making a small sitting area. I felt like if I sat there I should pose like a Mannequin in a glass case. Little did I know, the Pier House has other plans for that small little area, you know for it be a like a greenhouse. We had to close the curtains between this stupid little balcony and the room just to keep the rest of the room cool. This room represents where not to stay in the Pier House, Beach Building in RM 224. In our first room we were 1 stair way from exiting the hotel. In our second room, we were one stair way, a 100 yard right turn and another 50 yard walk to the exit of the property. I asked the front desk, what's the upgrade??? I got a response that resembled we're full that's all that's left. I guess I should be happy I still had some where to stay but for an upgrade I should have at least been given some seeds and a watering can for my greenhouse. So be wary at this hotel if they say your going to have to pay for an upgrade. What that means is a farther walk out of the hotel from a room that resembles any normal hotel room but with a greenhouse for a balcony. Other than that little part of the hotel, Key West is great. Lots to do for 7 days but if you don't drink, those could be 7 long nights. So make sure you stay in the flat panel TV room!!! Also if you want to stay when things are really going on. Stay April 22 - April 29. This is when Key west celebrates it becoming the Conch Republic. You'll fast learn about this event when your down there. Also if you stay around that week, they will reenact the battle of Key west. You can pay to go on a boat and fling rotten tomatoes and eggs at the coast guard while they spray you with water. It sounds immature for an older crowd but its really fun if you just get in with the overall tradition of the event. Anyway its a great place with a lot to see and do. Take the Conch Train, it will show you lots of places to go on your own. Have fun..

Reviews.Title: “Solid choice...great location!!!”
Reviews.Author: bobsakamano
Reviews.Content: We stayed here the first night of our two week trip because I wanted to see how nice this resort was and it did not disappoint. We just had a standard room that had a view of a building...but you get what you paid for so I cannot complain about that. The room was a bit aged, but not bad at all. The pool area was above average and the beach is nice for Key west standards. The beach bar was pretty good there too and I started off my trip with a Pina Colada with a 151 floater, which was icing on the cake. The highlight of our stay was One Duval restaurant. Service was great even though there was a wedding dinner there. Snapper was the best I've ever had. Service was good, but not great at the hotel besides the restaurant. Tried to leave a wedding welcome gift and was told that I had to leave it on the day the guests arrived to guarantee its delivery. It was the only hotel that gave us this problem, which I found interesting. Overall, nice place with beautiful landscaping that I might stay at again if Ocean Key's prices are too outrageous.

Reviews.Title: “The Best on the Island”
Reviews.Author: rayduche
Reviews.Content: This resort is the best you will find and Key West may be the most complete vacation experience avaiable in the states and/or the world! Key West is truly unique in that everyone I talk to about Key West has fallen in love with it for their own reasons. It is wonderfully diverse, perfect for the whole family during the day, and then lots of partying on Duval Streetat night. So much to do and see our eight days was not enough. Plan two weeks and bring plenty of money. And why not? Go and enjoy yourself and live like a rock star and there will be no regrets. Our trip was more than fantastic and the Pier House was a big reason. Among other reasons, the Pier House's location CANNOT get any better. email me if you'd like, I have lots of recommendations. Either way, plan a trip to Key West soon.

Reviews.Title: “best resort in key west”
Reviews.Author: h_wood23
Reviews.Content: This RESORT was excellent. It got some bad reviews and we (my fiancee and I, in our late 20's) were expecting the worst.
