We've traveled to many places and we were pleasantly surprised with what we got at the Pier House. The staff was friendly and attentive. The room was spotless and had a brand new mattress and flat screen HD-TV. The pool was really nice also clean (this is where we spent most of our day relaxing). The beach was nice and was private to the resort and although it was small, it was the best beach there was to offer in key west compared to the other hotels (we were nosey and checked them out). The beach staff gave out chairs and towels and raked it daily. The beach bar had good live music most of the time. The grounds and landscaping were well kept and pretty. Nothing was "run-down" or old. The prices we got for the Pier House were actually lower than most of the other hotels we looked into when booking and it was worth EVERY penny. There was not one bad thing to say about the Pier House. This was our first time in key west and this is the only resort we would ever consider WHEN we go back. PS...if you have a late flight back home, the front desk can give you complimentary spa passes to shower and "freshen up" if you can't get a later check out time. This was really convenient and the spa facilites were outstanding.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Would go back”
Reviews.Author: kitkat1223
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I (in our late 20's/early 30s)stayed at the Pier House in a Caribbean Spa Room last August 2005. We thought the hotel was outstanding - based on what your options are in key west. The resort is at the very end of Duval Street. They have their own private beach which is VERY small, but adequate considering there is not much in the way of beaches down there! We loved it! The pool area and outdoor cafe were great. We often went for midnight swims on the beach and in the pool. We were only asked by a security guard to show him our room key to prove we were guests of the hotel. You are very near everything at this hotel - which was very nice. We parked our car in the lot the day we got there and didn't move it until we sadly had to leave. I've stayed at a bed and breakfast in key west before which I would recommend, but if you like something a little more "resort" like this is the place. I would prefer this over the hyatt they have down there too - the peir house has less of a hotel feeling. The carribean spa room was HUGE too. Our view wasn't the best. It was a parking lot, but mostly covered with foliage anyway. The room had a huge bathroom and a music system you could play throughout. We never turned the TV on the entire time we were there. It was really a great hotel and I wouldn't stay anywhere else if I were to go back.

Reviews.Title: “I think the drifters sleeping in Mallory Square had better accomodations...”
Reviews.Author: SouthernChaos
Reviews.Content: My husband and I decided to take a vacation to Florida first stopping in Orlando, then splitting our time up between Key West and Key Largo. First of all we were in Key West this past week during spring break. We paid over $200 a night to stay in a standard room, which I think was attributed to it being spring break. Even though I booked last September, we were given room #190, right beside the lobby on the first floor. PLEASE STAY AWAY FROM THIS ROOM. We could hear EVERYTHING, everyone coming in and leaving all during the night. The room itself was literally disgusting. There were water marks or mold on the ceiling and the walls. The bathroom was equally disgusting and had small bugs not only crawling on the floor, but also eating other dead bugs. They were charging $10 a week just to rent a refrigerator, and there were no machines on premises to buy a bottle of water unless you count the $7.00 Evian available to purchase in your room. Of course it was hot, unless you wanted to rent the refrigerator, which meant you would be essentially be drinking a $17 bottle of water. Thanks goodness there was a CVS across the steet! We even shared a balcony with the room next door, and after inspecting the sliding glass doors that adjoined the balcony I did not feel safe. We were on the bottom floor, I feel like anyone that got access to our balcony could have also gained access to the room if they so desired. Thank goodness there were two queen beds and we got our pick. One of them had a stain not only on the bedspread covering it, but the sheets were stained as well. The mattresses looked like something they salvaged from Goodwill and had definitely seen better days. After our first night we were getting ready to head out to explore Key West for the day when we happen to notice something on the pillow. It was a dead centipede! I have no idea how it got there, and quite frankly when paying as much as we did for a luxury resort, we shouldn't have to wonder such things. I can honestly say that the only good thing about this place was its location. It was nice to drink at the bars and then be able to walk home. The outside of the resort if you can call it that, is definitely deceiving. Bottom line is, the inside of the resort is pathetic. They have taken no measures to update the facilities, and have not gone out of their way to make the person staying there feel at home. Next time I go to Key West, I know where I won't be staying!

Reviews.Title: “Location is all you get.”
Reviews.Author: mandchutchins
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a "Junior Suite" at the Pier House for 2 nights beginning on March 6, 2006. Although the location is as central as you will find in Key West and the ocean veiws spectacular it was not worth the $600 per night. We consider ourselves well seasoned trtavellers and have stayed at truly 5 star hotels and this one does not deserve that misleading title. The staff was helpful and quick to respond to our requests but the physical plant needs some serious renovation and updating. Even the bathroom was worn the towel bar was hanging off the wall. This hotel deserves a new investor who will maximize the beauty of the location.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was our second visit Feb.5-6-7-2006. We are ready to go back and will in 2007 great location. The room was large clean and comfortable. The beach was clean and very relaxing just like 2005.

Reviews.Title: “Tenth stay, every time a winner”
Reviews.Author: SD92101
Reviews.Content: In spite of a hurricane just three weeks before our arrival, Pier House was looking good and once again provided a beautiful, relaxing setting for our most recent trip to Key West. Our favorite room was ready for us and freshly and charmingly redecorated. The Caribbean Spa was redecorated and expanded, all improvements nicely done. Staff always ready to do whatever they could to make our stay even better. Thanks Pier House, keep up the good work!

Reviews.Title: “21st Birthday trip”
Reviews.Author: JimfBearDE
Reviews.Content: This was our second time to the Pier House and it was my sons 21st birthday present. Twelve people (six couples) went for five days. Everyone is ready to go back immediately. What else can be said: Your in Key West, you have a private beach, pool and four great bars. Yes it's expensive but it's Key West and a vacation so prepare for it. Great hotel and staff. Will return in 2007.

Reviews.Title: “our room was broken into”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: our room was broken into (while we were in it asleep!!!)and we found out later that another couples room was broken into a few days before. the hotel did nothing to "warn" people or put on extra security. Things of a horrible nature were done that i won't go into here. The hotel made us pay for the room even though we had this happen to us. Would not reccomend to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “very enjoyable stay at Pier House”
Reviews.Author: jmckib
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Pier House from 11/19-11/26/05. It was our second visit to the Pier House, the first being our honeymoon 18+ years earlier. We reserved a basic room and it was on the first floor, near the lobby. The only negative was our room's patio was right across from the Chart Room bar and adjacent to a main walkway, so there was some noise. We're not terribly bothered by noise and most nights we were bone tired so it wasn't a big deal. I could see fussy types being annoyed by this. If so, avoid room 187. All of Key West showed a lot of damage to trees and vegetation due to the recent hurricane season. Things at the PH looked surprisingly good, but some of the taller palm trees clearly took a beating. All the grounds were neatly maincured and well maintained. The pool and beach area were in good shape. The water temperature in the pool was perfect. The nearby jacuzzi was great too and was very relaxing after a hard day spent being a tourist. Waitresses are very attentive to both beach and pool patrons all day. One of the PH's best features is the location. It's just a few blocks from all of old town KW's main attractions. We had a car the first few days we were there and they have lots of free parking. I seem to recall that parking was more limited 18 years ago. The biggest knock against the PH is the price. It's nice but expensive. I don't expect budget prices, but I never saw any drink specials or anything remotely resembling a discount. A Coors Light ran $4.50, a mojito or margarita was $7.50 or $8.00 and the very tasty Key Lime colada a whopping $11.00. We're not heavy drinkers, but if you are it might be good to drink elsewhere. We did some other sidetrips while there. My wife did the sea lion swim at Theater of the Sea in Islamorada and we took a seaplane to the Dry Tortugas. If you have any questions, feel free to ask. Your old pal, Joe jmckib@cinci.rr.com

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: namato1
Reviews.Content: Talk about the perfect location! This was it, walking distance to everything. Right at the end of Duval yet off to the side so you can get away from the noise if you want. I had a standard room in the Beach building. Nothing fancy and no view but for the amount of time I was in the room who cares. The room was clean and comfortable which is all I needed. The staff is excellent and very friendly. The bar on the deck above One Duval resturant is the perfect spot to watch the sunset. Small beach with a nice bar for a few afternoon drinks and snacks. The Reach cancelled my reservations 5 days prior to my trip and I was lucky enough to get a room at the Pier House. I plan on calling the Reach and thanking them!

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, spa rooms are great”
Reviews.Author: dottie dog
Reviews.Content: Pier house has a great location (right at the end of Duval street, near good restaurants, etc. Our room was in the spa building, which was nice. Our very large balcony overlooked the parking lot, but it was never noisy. The room has hardwood floors, nice spacious bathroom with jacuzzi tub. The beach is very small -- but pool was ok. Staff was very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Pass on the Pier House!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a 2 night stay at the Pier House in Key West and wished I had spent my money elsewhere. I booked a Harborside room and upon check-in I was so sad to see the shape of the room - this was not the luxury resort I had hoped for. The view was lovely (direct waterfront) but everything in the room was tired! The mattress was worn and at a slant, there were water stains on the walls and I have seen better bathrooms at a Motel 6. I decided to spend more money and upgrade to a larger Harborside room and although it was a slight improvement, the room was still far from "Luxury". Ants and a massive roach near the bed were the final straw. The location is great, everything is within walking distance - just don't expect this to be a "luxury" resort and you won't be disappointed. But if you want more bang for $300.00 a night - look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Always lives up to expectations”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Pier House on three seperate occasions. I have always been extremely happy with the accomodations. The hotel is a little bit of paradise with it's wonderful island look and theme. It is my choice of hotels on Key West!
